To make a living, Angelie owns and operates a banana production business. Angelie has been in her business for 5 years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month for her work. 

In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting. This will be Angelie's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting

loans.name: Aishakul's Group

texts.en:
Aishakul is the leader of this group. She is 52 and, unfortunately, a widow. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son works in construction and her daughter goes to school. A year ago, Aishakul collected 500 kg of apples from her garden. She sold that harvest and gained a profit in the amount of 5000 KGS. Since that time, she has been selling apples and pears to support her livelihood. With money received from the loan, Aishakul wants to purchase 1.5 tons of apples to resell at a higher price to gain profit. In the future, she plans to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 1.5 tons of apples.

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita is widowed with 2 children. Shirlita is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Shirlita earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, candies and etc.
Shirlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Shirlita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, candies and etc

loans.name: Gena

texts.en: Gena is married with four children. She is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. Gena is a farmer and grows hogs to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 14,950 PHP to purchase pigs for her piggery business. Gena has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her piggery business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. Her business is well, clean, and good. She owns a hardware business. She has two years experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business runs from 6:30am until 7:30pm every day. 

Mariam has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her hardware business by purchasing more goods for resale. With any profit from the loan, Mariam will expand her business, save for her family, and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to expand her hardware business by purchasing more goods for resale.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Ligaya helps her husband in cultivating their 1.5 hectares of farm lots by planting corn. They have been in this business for almost 16 years and usually earn a profit of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in every harvest season. They have four adult children, two of whom are still in college level. Due to high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to earn more income to support their children's education and satisfy their daily needs. 

They planned to expand their corn plantation to ensure high yields and income,b ut due to financial difficulty, Ligaya is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in planting corn. They believe that through this loan, they will be able to work out their plan and make an improvement in their business to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in planting corn.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 29 years old and single. He has two years of experience selling timber. He currently employs two people to help him and his business is open from 7 am to 6 pm every day except on Saturday. 

Japhet has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more timber for resale. With any profits, he would like to satisfy his basic needs, reinvest in his business and build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang is a 25-year-old married man who is in the business of selling firewood. His wife is a local farmer in the Baray district. This young couple is blessed with a small kid. Leang typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.50 each day to support his family. Currently, Leang is concerned about his business because his buffalo is too old to haul the firewood-trailer. With this loan, Leang will buy an additional buffalo for transporting his products. In the future, he’ll expand his business and save some money for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for transporting his products.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.en:
Toribio is 50 years old, married to Perla, and together they are raising three children who are in school. His family lives a less fortunate lifestyle. To make a living, Toribio cultivates rice as the source of his income. He plants and harvest rice. Sometimes, his spouse also helps him in transplanting rice seedlings to the farm. According to him, rice farming requires patience and determination. He wants to achieve more crop production so he is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy pesticides and fertilizers to ensure a good crop in his rice field.

In the future, he would like to continue generating good income from his farming business. Toribio also promises to pay the said loan amount on time.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to ensure a good crop in his rice field.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. Her business is clean and good. She sells various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc. She has two years of experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business runs from 6am until 9pm every day except Sunday.

Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc to sell. With any profit from the loan, Vestine will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to expand her boutique by purchasing various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc to sell.

loans.name: Aktunuk's Group

texts.en:
Aktunuk is the treasurer of this group. She is 23 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons, both of whom are of preschool age (under seven). Two years ago, with an initial investment of 4000 soms, Aktunuk started to breed cattle. She sells dairy products and in this way she earns an additional 500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. The purpose of the loan is a purchase of a calf. In the future, she wants to provide her sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Gilyn's Group

texts.en:
Gilyn is 40 years old and lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. Gilyn has a shop where she sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of PHP3000 to buy more canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. 

Gilyn is a newly member of PMPC. In the future, Gilyn hopes to save money for her children’s education. Gilyn is the leader of a four person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, etc.

location.town: Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
This is Normita, 53, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver and vendor, and father to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Normita operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a profit. Her products are bags, shoes, RTW(ready to wear) clothes and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Normita is requesting a PHP13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Normita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie is 49 years and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

To earn a living, Jeanie is engaged in a backyard piggery business and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP5000 to buy feed and medicines for her pig raising business.

Jeanie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 9 months. She would like to improve the living conditions of her family and able to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is a 30-year old mother of two children, who are still in school. She also has one sister living with her. To make a living, she has been farming for 11 years in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. To better feed her family, she also plants cassava to generate additional income. 

This is Sopheak's first loan with VisionFund. She is now requesting for a loan. She will use this loan to build a small tailor shop for her sister. With this loan, she hopes to better support her sister to have a good business with regular income, which will generate more income for the family and also build on some savings for the future to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a small tailor shop for her sister.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 63 years old, a widow with 5 adult children. She is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Rizalina owns and operates a farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She's been in this business for 20 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be the 29th loan taken out by Rizalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is married and has four sons. All of them left their education without completion and started working as masons.

Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells fresh quality seasonal fruits to his clients at low rates. He is very fair in his customer dealings and makes good sales everyday. He gets up early in the morning and goes to the fruit market so he can purchase the quality fruits for selling. He is very dedicated to his work and he never compromises on quality and services. 

Azra is also very caring in nature. She not only manages her household responsibilities efficiently but also gives the required time to her sewing works. Her quality sewing helps her encourage her clients to take on her services. She utilizes her income in paying off the utility expenses.

She is requesting for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh quality seasonal fruits for selling to his clients to obtain higher profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Azra is confident that an investment will help him improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for a fruit selling business.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en: Alaa' is a 27-year-old young woman. She has a grocery store which is her only source of income. Alaa' wants to get a better collection of groceries. She needs to increase her income, so she needs to purchase more groceries to resell. Alaa' does not have enough money to pay for these additional groceries, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When she gets the loan she will be able to purchase more groceries. This will enable her to have a better collection, sell more, and increase her income to provide better living conditions for herself. Alaa' is a conservative woman, so her brother Ismael is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally (photographed) is 51 years old. Her husband, Kheing, is 60 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have two married children: one son and one daughter. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally sells porridge in the market, while her husband is a mechanic. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to repair the walls of her house because the old ones are broken.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Tot

texts.en: From Pouk district of Siem Reap province, a 41-year-old married woman, Mrs. Tot, is selling groceries from a booth in front of her own house. Every day Mrs. Tot has to get up in the early morning to buy groceries from her frequent suppliers at a local market. She then takes the groceries home, selling to the people in her village at a profitable price. She usually earns approximately $5.00 per day from this business. Mrs. Tot has got only 2 children, one of whom is already married and lives away. Mrs. Tot would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a buffalo that can be used on her farmland. For the future plan, she will expand her sales business and sell many kinds of household products.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo that can be used on her farmland.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is married and has two children. Lelia is 27 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.

Lelia have general store from which she earns a living. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP14000 to purchase beverages and stocks for her general store. Lelia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy is 52 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village. She has three children who were married. She is a farmer. Not only growing rice and raising pigs but she also sells pork in the market. She has this job for ten years. 

Quy has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and the last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and she repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy pork to sell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband Kosal is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four sons and two daughters. Four of the children are in school and the other two help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh.

Touch is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia remains illiterate due to financial constraints. Her parents couldn't provide her with a quality education, but her mother, who was very talented, taught her excellent sewing skills. She has adopted sewing as her profession, and she takes care of her family's expenses.

Shazia is married and lives with her husband and two children. Her husband operates a donkey cart and provides loading services to his customers. With his cart he delivers different kinds of items such as construction supplies, furniture, and other goods to their destinations. He is very good at his work and puts all of his effort into providing quality services to his clients.

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become worn and needs replacement. By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to carry more loads and provide better service to his clients. He is very experienced and has been operating his business for many years. Shazia is hopeful that a loan will help him to improve his business and will increase his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for her husband's loading business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosemarie has a shop from which she sells canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to support children's education to college level.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Wekhoyela Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Wekhoyela group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wekhoyela group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

David and the group members appear in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is widowed and has 4 children. Merlinda is 58 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Merlinda sells cheese cake, pancakes and ice candy to earn a living. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase additional ingredients for snacks such as cheesecake, pancakes and ice candy.

Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Merlinda hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for snacks such as cheese cake, pancakes and ice candy.

loans.name: Grace Nora

texts.en:
This is Grace, a 36-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roel, who is also her partner in business, and the mother of one child. Grace and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Grace is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a room rental business. She offers rooms for rent in the family's house that local students and workers rent on a monthly basis. She also operates some arcade machines in part of the house for additional income. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in rent every month.

To help her continue operating her business, Grace is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of the rental rooms and arcade units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of her room rentals and arcade units.

loans.name: Joenalyn

texts.en:
Joenalyn is 27 and a responsible housewife who has two infant children. She is married to a farmer, and they are raising their family in a village. They want to become financially stable so that they will be able to support their children's education and give them a bright future. They plan to cultivate their farm plots by planting corn and vegetables to sell.

Despite the hardships and difficulties they face in life, they want to pursue their business by expanding their corn plantation to ensure high yields. Due to inadequate capital, Joenalyn is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor costs for land preparation and planting the corn. They believe that their patience and hard work will enable them to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gracia

texts.en:
Gracia's priority in life is to earn a living. She is 40 years old and married with three children who are currently studying. Gracia is happily living with her husband and children in the community of San Miguel Ramon. She has been using her skills in manicuring, pedicuring, hair coloring, and hair cutting. Because Gracia doesn't have an established beauty salon, she travels from house to house to satisfy her customers' needs. She is grateful because she is able to earn about PHP 10,000 per month, which she uses to meet her family's daily needs, to provide allowances and tuition fees for her children, and to buy feed to raise hogs.

Gracia and her husband work hard to meet the needs of their family. Her husband is a farmer, and at times he doesn't have to look after his rice field. So he has been doing construction activities to provide additional income. Gracia still needs additional capital due to increased household expenses and the costs of her hog-raising business. 

Gracia is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which she will use to purchase materials such as nail polish remover, nail polish, and hair coloring for her beauty business. She believes that by giving her customers quality services, she will earn their trust, which will make her business grow. Gracia says that, in this way, her customers will increase and so will the income she will generate. This would be a great help to her family because she could give them a better future and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her beauty services.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy commercial fertilizer for her corn. 

Carmencita has been a member of PMPC for years. In the future, Carmencita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy commercial fertilizer for her corn

location.town: Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Susanna

texts.ru:
Сусанна родилась в Грузии в 1958. Сейчас она живет в Армении, в деревне Ачаджур, Тавушского региона. Она замужем и у нее есть сын, который живет отдельно и в скором времени собирается жениться. Муж Сусанны пенсионер. Сама Сусанна преподает и параллельно занимается растениеводством. 
Вместе с мужем у них есть небольшой виноградник и сад, в котором они выращивают сливы, яблоки и корольки. В основном они используют полученную продукцию для нужд своей собственной семьи, но, когда выдаются особо урожайные года, они продают часть своей продукции. Для увеличения дохода своей семьи, Сусанна и ее муж хотят начать выращивать фрукты на продажу, и для этой цели им необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм. С помощью кредита они смогут огородить участок для сада и приобрести саженцы корольковых и инжирных деревьев.
texts.en: Susanna was born in Georgia in 1958 and currently lives in Armenia, in the Achadjur village of the Tavush region.  She is married and has a son, who lives separately and plans to get married soon.  Susanna's husband is a retiree.  Susanna teaches and parallel to that is involved in gardening.  Her husband and she have a small vineyard and garden, where they grow plums, apples and persimmons.  They primarily use their harvest to satisfy their own family needs, but when the harvest is especially rich, they sell part of their product.  In order to increase their family income, Susanna and her husband want to start growing fruits for sale and need a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram for this purpose.  They will able to use the loan to fence off a plot of land for a garden and buy persimmon and fig trees.

loans.use: to fence off garden and to buy persimmon and fig trees

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with 4 children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Virginia is a farmer who raises corn for a living. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to save money.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 36 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, in the district of Yen Phong, in Bac Ninh province. She has two children who are in school.

Lien has been selling fruit in the market for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. This is the 6th time she has requested a loan from SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy fruit for resale.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old and produces rice as her source of income. Together with her spouse, she has managed a farming business for 10 years, planting and harvesting rice. She decided to engage in this kind of work because she only finished high school and wasn't able to find other employment.

Teresa needs additional capital to make her business more profitable. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy six bags of urea (fertilizer) and pesticides. She hopes that this loan will help improve her crop production.

In the future, she would like to keep generating a good income from her business and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Jemalin

texts.en:
Jemalin is 25 years old and presently lives in San Pedro, Dumingag, in the province of Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children and has had a farm for more than 4 years.

Jemalin has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for her farm. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 2 years. She hopes to earn a lot from her farm and to be able to provide her family with a better future with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn production

loans.name: Ngendelele Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ngendelele SHG Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Ngendelele SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Alice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ngendelele SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is married with 4 children. He is 47 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, in the province of Zamboanga Sibugay.

Joey has been selling rice and corn for a living for 24 years. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell/retail. He became a member of PMPC in 2011. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell/retail

loans.name: Norienza

texts.en:
Norienza is 43 years old and lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has three school age children.

To earn a living, Norienza has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase ingredients for her snacks vending business.

Norienza has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 7 months. In the future, Norienza would like to finance her children's studying.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 46 years old, married, and has ten children. She's from Gala Ozamis City. 

To make her living, Elma owns and operates a banana production business. Elma has been 30 years engaged in her business and she earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 12,598.62 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is 45 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 5 children.

Lito works in the fishing industry and sells/catches fish for living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested loan of PHP50,000 to purchase fishnets and a fishing boat for her fishing business.

Lito has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Lito hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and a fishing boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: 050702-Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 050702-Đông Ngọc-Hoằng Phong-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngân works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2003, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run, 41, is a responsible housewife who always takes care of the family, especially her small kids. She is in the business of selling mixed products like groceries, packaged foods and sweets from a small store inside her own her house. Typically, she makes a profit of around $2.00 per day. She also takes some time to educate her children to be good people in society. 

This family doesn’t have a motorcycle yet, so every day wherever they go, they have to spend money for motor-taxi services. Mrs. Run said that it’ll be better if she has a motorcycle for her family to use. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a second-hand motorcycle. She hopes that she’ll have comfortable living through using this loan. She is very happy and thankful to all Kiva’s lenders.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Mơ's Group

texts.en:
Mơ is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province. Mơ is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 3 (16).

Mơ is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To making a living, Mơ owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily chickens, for sale. Mơ has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mơ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  Mơ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies used in raising quail and chicken. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mơ from SEDA. Mơ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Phượng is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (pigs).
2.  Liên is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (pigs and chickens).
3.  Hạnh is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock (chickens).

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 55 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 7 children. 

Marita has a shop where she sells products such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, etc. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, etc.

Marita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Marita hopes to send children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 30 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 children. 

Evangeline has a shop where she sells canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP11,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Evangeline hopes to send children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Clemenia

texts.en:
Clemenia is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children. Clemenia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Clemenia operates a business venture selling a variety of fruit and vegetable in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and she earns 8,600 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Clemenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is married and has four adult children. Felixberta is 59 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. 
 
Felixberta is a farmer and raises pigs in the backyard to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 9,000.00 to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Felixberta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than 1 year. Felixberta hopes to sustain her business and help her family to renovate their house out of the profit in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for raising pigs.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 21 years old. She is married and has two children. They are still small. Her main job is farming. Not only growing rice and raising chicken, she also buys and sells scrap iron. She has this job for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). 

Hien has participated in SEDA since 2009. This is the 4th time she has borrowed money from SEDA. The last time she borrowed 4,256,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time she wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42-years-old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two school-age children.

Divina has an iron scrap and plastic business and earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to  purchase  recycled materials  such as plastic and iron scrap materials.

Divina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Divina hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase  recycled materials such as plastic and iron scrap materials.

loans.name: Jezreel

texts.en:
Jezreel is 29-years-old, married and is from Viray Molicay, Ozamis City. 

Jezreel owns and operates a farm land; planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. Jezreel has been 10 years in his farming business and he earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Jezreel joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and an ability to engage in business activities. Jezreel is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Jezreel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with two children. Delia is 46-years-old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City.

Delia sells cosmetic products such as Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase cosmetic products such as Avon products to sell.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ester hopes to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products such as Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita believes that "a person who has strong determination will become successful." She is a hard-working mother who is blessed with nine children. 

The main source of their income is through farming. They help each other in managing their farm by planting rice and vegetables for sale. Rosita is also engaged in hog-raising business to earn additional income. They plan to educate all their children so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

Despite financial difficulty, they have the strong determination to uplift their status of living. Rosita aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: 030709-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Xuân is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 030709-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Xuân has a manufacturing business, knitting bags to export. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to maintain her business.

In 2010, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Xuân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy more land, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to maintain her business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Alaa has owned an electric generator since 2009, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for $2,000 to purchase spare parts for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more crates of both soft and hard drinks to resell.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 26 years old, married and has four children who need daily allowances. She was only 19 when she got married. She only finished her high school education and wasn't able to seek employment. 

Luckily, Remalyn and her spouse inherited a hectare plot of land from her in-laws that they have been cultivating for almost three years. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. 

She wants to increase her crop production but she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming.
 
In the future, she would like to ensure good crops and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 36 years old and married to a farmer. They are thankful because they were blessed with three healthy children.

Marietta has owned and managed her retail store for five years and she is able to earn about PHP 5,000 per month. She utilizes her income for the family’s daily household expenses:  allowances, her children’s tuition fees, and an amount toward the maintenance of her rice fields.
 
In this situation, Marietta is aiming to increase her sales and profits because her income is not enough to cover all their daily household expenditures. Marietta is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase   merchandise such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, milk, sugar, ingredients, shampoo, and detergent for her retailing business. 

Marietta said that running a retail store is quite difficult due to some customers’ credit. So, nowadays she does not allow credit because it prevents her from reinvesting her income to make her business grow.

She is hoping that she could continually acquire financial assistance from the lending institution, so that she could improve her financial stability and improve her family’s living conditions. Through this loan amount, she could attain her goal in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, milk, sugar, ingredients, shampoo, and detergent for her retail business.

loans.name: 02.01.04 Đông Hải -Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên has a service business carrying sand. She is requesting a loan to purchase gas to run a boat to carry sand for community.

Liên is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hóa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the group leader of the 02.01.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase gas to run a boat to carry sand on the river for community

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, aged 44, and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gilbert, a tricycle driver, and is a mother to their children. By the grace of God, Marina has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle (motor with side car) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community, all of which are paying boundary (daily fee) each day. Marina’s husband drives their tricycle. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 21, 000. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle and also to open up another business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marina dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Temakho A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Temakho A Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Temakho A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jane was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Temakho A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shahera

texts.en:
Shahera, 24, is married and has one son. Shahera is a conservative woman, so her husband, Younis, is photographed instead.
Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Shahera has a Play Station cafe and she wants to expand and improve her cafe by purchasing more Play Station machines. The amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When she gets the loan, she will purchase more Play Station machines. This will increase her customers and improve her work positively. It will increase her income so her family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more Play Station machines.

loans.name: 01.03.09 Đông Sơn-Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a manufacturing business making charcoal. Hường has been involved in this business for five years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase material to maintain her charcoal factory. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 01.03.09 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 

This is Hường’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase material to maintain her charcoal factory.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a young, kind, and very responsible woman. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 19. She is happy with her children and husband by her side. She shares her house with them, where they strive daily very much to attain a better quality of life.

Sakina’s work consists of sewing. Her work is home-based. She sews every kind of dress, which motivates her clients to get her services. She started this business a few years ago with few clientele, but due to her efforts, her business has been able to grow gradually with improved numbers of clientele.

Her husband is involved in the animal sales business. He has enough experience in his business. He buys young animals for a small amount from the animal markets and sells them for good profits after raising them.  His sales are good because he stocks good animals and guarantees that his customers can expect to get what they desire. 

To make his business grow and to improve his business’s financial status, Sakina is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. Her husband will use the loan for purchasing animals (goats) in larger numbers to sell. 

She is hopeful that her husband‘s business will grow after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy animals (goats) for the animal sales business.

loans.name: Mavesi C B O Group

texts.en:
James takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, James had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, James was only able to harvest 1 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, James will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments.

James is the facilitator of the Mavesi CBO group. As with the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, James and his fellow group members are farmers who rely on maize for income and food security. James and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mavesi CBO group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. In the photograph above, James is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears on the far left of the photograph. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vidal, a farmer, and is a mother to their four children, two of whom are working while the other two have their own families already. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Editha makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She’s been ten years in this business. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting, such as fertilizer, pots, and seedlings, and to pay their monthly water bills. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Editha hopes her business grows in the coming years, and she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.ru:
Геворгу 25 лет, он женат и у него уже есть 9-месячный сын. Геворг с семьей проживает с Ереване. Также с ними живут родители Геворга и его брат. 
Геворг профессиональный фотограф и уже более 5 лет он работает по заказу: снимает на фото- и видеокамеру свадебные церемонии, крестины, дни рождения и т.д. Также он делает видеомонтаж сделанных им видеосъемок. Геворг всегда выполняет свою работу качественно и высокопрофессионально, благодаря чему у него никогда не бывает недостатка в заказах. Он научил своего брата видеомонтажу и когда у Геворга бывает очень много заказов, его брат помогает ему. Благодаря своему бизнесу Геворг содержит свою семью. Геворгу необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для покупки новой профессиональной видеокамеры для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gevorg is twenty-five years old, married and has a nine-month-old baby son. He lives with his family, brother and parents in Yerevan. Gevorg is a professional photographer and has freelanced for the last five years: he photographs and videos weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc. He also video edits his work. 

Due to his professionalism and consistent high quality work, Gevorg has never experienced a lack of orders. 
He taught his brother video editing and when confronted with an excess of work, his brother assists him. Thanks to this business, Gevorg is able to provide for his family. 

Gevorg is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 drams in order to purchase a new professional video camera.

loans.use: To buy a new professional video camera for his business

loans.name: Edesia

texts.en: Edesia is married with 6 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Edesia owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns about Php 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase stock for her general store. She became a member of PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Edesia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 64 years old lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to four children. All of them have their own family already. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   

Catalina makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She’s been 22 years in this business, and she earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 25,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting, such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, plastics and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Catalina hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Diyaa has owned a men’s clothing and accessories shop since 2006.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area, so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is applying for a loan of $1800 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a mother who has the strong determination to improve their status of living to give her children a bright future. She is now 51 and has eight adult children. She and her husband helped each other in cultivating their farm lots by planting rice and vegetables for sale. Despite the hardships in farming, they are confident about increasing their yields. 

They planned to plant and produce more squash for sale to increase their income. But due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy squash seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in the squash plantation. They mentioned that this loan will enable them to work out their plan. They hope that they will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy squash seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in the squash plantation.

loans.name: Saheb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has five children.

Saheb is a tailor. He has owned a workshop since 2000, making, repairing or altering clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has more than 10 years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more stuff to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to add more stuff to his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Elbert

texts.en:
Elbert is 34 years old and lives in Ponong, Larena, Siquijor.  He is married with three children. Elbert has a backyard piggery to earn a living, and he has had this business for 14 years. He earns about PHP 2,500 a week doing this type of work. 

He requested a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase medicines and feeds for his backyard piggery business. Elbert is a new member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He hopes to grow his business and have savings deposited for his children's future education.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and feeds for his backyard piggery business.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sabreen wants to improve her family's home living conditions by purchasing necessary new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her children, living room furniture, a kitchen table, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Sabreen gets the loan, she will purchase what furniture the family needs to live in better home conditions. Sabreen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned an electric generator since 2007, leasing electric lines for his area and surrounding areas. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to replace the power lines' spare parts. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to replace the power lines' spare parts

loans.name: Muniran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Muniran bibi is young, 26 years old, kind and is a very responsible woman. She is married and has two sons, who are 4 and a half and 2 years old. She is happy with her children and husband by her side. She shares her house with them, where she and her husband strive daily to attain a better quality of life.
 
Muniran’s work is in sewing. Her work is home-based. She is well-experienced in her business. Her business has increased the demand in her community and her respect amongst her clients. Initially, she started her business for her relatives but later her sewing skills couldn't be hidden and it was opened to her neighboring areas. Now she receives good orders and fulfills them on time to earn good profits.  

Her husband is a daily wage laborer. His work is not permanent - sometimes he gets work and sometimes not. For improving her finances and the clientage, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She will use the loan to buy fiber of different colors in bulk quantity to be able to sew a good number of clothes and increase her profits. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business.

loans.use: to buy fiber for sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more land to expand his farm.

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete SHG Group in Western Kenya! Janemary is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janemary takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janemary had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janemary was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Janemary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Janemary and some of her members appear in the photograph but one member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Ofelia helps her parents in managing their rice farming business. She is 25 years old and still single. She aimed to earn and save to satisfy their needs and help her parents in financing the education of her younger brothers and sisters. She planned to expand their rice plantation to increase their yields.

She wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the rice farming business. She mentioned that her loan will help them to improve their rice production. She is hoping that someday she will find a good job and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is living with his parents in the village of Turod Norte, Cordon. He is 33 years old and still single. He has run and managed the family's rice fields for almost ten years with his patience and dedication to improving his rice farming business. He is requesting for a loan amounting to PHP 35,000, allowing him to purchase some farm supplies needed to improve his agricultural business. This loan would really help him in making his rice production more profitable.

Ernesto hopes that his yield for next crop season will increase so that he could provide for his family's needs. He believes that he could be a successful farmer someday, though he is facing some hardships in maintaining his rice field.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies needed to improve his agricultural business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more foodstuffs

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with three family members, two of whom work.

Issam has owned a barber shop since 1997.  He offers hair cuts, shaving and trimming beards. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer need and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to repair and fix his shop’s floor and to make an outdoor ceiling.  He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s floor and to make an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 33-year-old young woman, she is married and has two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a municipality employee with a decent salary. 

Reem wants to change her old home furniture and purchase new furniture such as dinning room furniture and living room seats to give her family better living conditions but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the furniture.  So she needs to borrow a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.  When Reem gets the loan, she will purchase new home furniture and change the old furniture.  This will positively change her family's living conditions.  Reem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to change the old home furniture and purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Aitbubu's Group

texts.en:
Aitbubu is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married to a welder. Together with her husband she has raised three sons. The youngest son is 27, and he lives with his parents and helps them with housework.  Aitbubu works as a librarian at school. Twenty years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, she started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening she earns approximately an additional 1,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and future reselling. In the future she wishes to leave her sons a good inheritance.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.

Naim has been an owner of a food market since 2007.  He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field.  His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2000 in order to make an outdoor ceiling, an aluminum showcase and to add more foodstuffs to his market.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, an aluminum showcase and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Nasyoya Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nasyoya Group in Western Kenya! Felisters is the facilitator of the Nasyoya group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Felisters takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Felisters had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Felisters was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Felisters and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Felisters will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Nasyoya group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kisawayi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kisawayi B Group in Western Kenya! Immaculate is the facilitator of the Kisawayi B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Immaculate takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Immaculate had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 1/2 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Immaculate was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Immaculate and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Immaculate will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kisawayi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армену 55 лет, он родился в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы он поступил Капанский  строительный техникум. Армен женат и у него трое детей: два сына и дочь. Старший сын не работает и живет с родителями, а младший сын и дочь живут отдельно со своими семьями. Жена Армена работает библиотекаршей в районной библиотеке.
С 2005 года Армен занимается частным предпринимательством на городском рынке, где он арендует небольшое помещение. Он продает автозапчасти, которые дважды в месяц приобретает в Ереване. Благодаря бизнесу Армен обеспечивает постоянный доход своей семьи. Армен работает без выходных и у него много постоянных клиентов. 
Армен получал кредит от организации уже 5 раз, и  сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для приобретения тормозных колодок, фар,  моторных масел, красок, инструментов, и т.д. для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Armen is fifty-five years old; he was born in the city of Kapan. After graduating high school, he enrolled in Kapan's construction college. 
Armen is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. His oldest son is unemployed and lives with his parents; the younger son and daughter live separately with their own families. Armen's wife works as a librarian in the local library. 

In 2005, Armen began his business as an entrepreneur on the local market where he rents a small shop. He sells autoparts, which he purchases two times a month in Yerevan. Thanks to his business, Armen is able to provide for his family. He works without weekends and has accumulated many regular customers.
