Armen has already received loans five times. Now he's requesting 800,000 drams in order to purchase brake shoes, headlights, engine oil, paints, instruments, etc. for his store.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture in preparation for his wedding.

loans.name: Maymneh

texts.en:
Maymneh is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and two school-aged children. She started working as a tailor in her home in 2005 and at the same time has her second job in a local company. Her husband has been working with his own pickup since 1990, transporting products from town to town.

Today, Maymneh is asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to cover her children’s studying fees, in order to help them enrich their skills and allow them to achieve higher positions. In the future, she plans to work on new designs, boost her productivity and therefore enhance her way of living.

loans.use: to cover her children’s studying fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase palm oil, coffee, cloth and other diverse products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and sugar beans.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам начал заниматься бизнесом 12 лет назад. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Он выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. На 2 гектарах земли он выращивает картошку и на 6 гектарах пшеницу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для содержания своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки 6 голов скота  и корма для них, с целью расширения бизнеса. На полученный ежегодный доход расширяет свое хозяйство, а часть дохода расходует на благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Uktam launched his business 12 years ago. He is married and has four children. He grows agricultural produce. He grows potatoes on two hectares of land and wheat on six hectares of land. He would like to expand his business and obtain good revenues in order to support his children. He would like to obtain a loan in order to buy six heads of cattle as well as animal feed for them, so as to expand his business. He keeps expanding his business with the annual revenues he gets, and uses part of the revenue to improve his family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she brings up four children. Three sons study at school and the youngest son is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the family needs Dinara cultivates agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns about 2000 soms per month. The profits gained from this activity helped the family to save money to purchase a mini-bus for transporting passengers and make additional money. With money received from the loan, Dinara wants to purchase 60kg of barley. In the near future she plans to start selling wheat and barley.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 60kg of barley

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 38-year-old young woman, she is married and has one son.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Mona is looking to improve her home by making some repairs such as painting and changing tiles and purchasing new home furniture such as living room seats and a kitchen table but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this so she needs to borrow a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.  When she gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and make some repairs.  This will change her life positively and offer her family better living conditions.  Mona is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture and make some home repairs.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She seeks to offer her children a proper life and also respond to all their needs. She’s a brave woman who decided to open her own cell phones shop eleven years ago in order to take a bit of their livelihood responsibilities from her husband. As for him, he works on his own in his local shop. Today, she’s looking to borrow $3000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l . She notes that this will improve her income. In the future, she plans to add new items such as laptops, televisions and many other items to her shop.

loans.use: to renew her shop and changes its interior design.

loans.name: St Monicah Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the St Monicah group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evans takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Evans will buy land and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of St Monicah group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 43 years old, married and has two children who work.

Ali has owned a barber shop since 2009. He offers hair cuts, shaves and beard trimming.  He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to make an aluminum showcase and to purchase a barber chair.  He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to make an aluminum showcase and to purchase a barber chair.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha, 35, is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation of food staff from the market to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a clothes selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Tatenda Group

texts.en:
Shillah is a 34-year-old lady and she is a single mother with 3 children aged 14, 12 and 5 years old. Two of the children are going to school. She does not have other dependants. 

She is a general dealer who sells groceries and clothing at Save Business Centre. She has been in business for seven years now and is doing well. She has 3 employees who work for her. She does not face any challenge other than of lack of capital. In the next 5 years she wants to acquire another business stand so that she wll have two business shops at Save. With the profits from the laon she will be able to pay fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to buy groceries for restocking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children who are all working. There are unified, depending on each other and grateful for what God has given them. Rima has owned a lingerie shop for the past five years. Today, she wants to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge her shop and buy additionA. lingerie in order to earn superior income. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop and buy added lingerie.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, married and has four children.

Hiam has owned a cow farm since 2003, raising cattle for milk and cheese. She has sufficient experience in this field from her parents and her husband. She has a good reputation and she is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a Friesian cow. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net, 32, is married and has four children who are still living with the family. Two of them are still in school, while the other two work for others to raise additional income to support the family. She just started planting cassava, more than a year ago, in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also sells fried bananas, and her husband is a motor taxi driver. Nowadays, she can earn around seven dollars per day to feed her family. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees and pay for laborers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to produce more cassava and earn more income for her family, and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Mme Maguette  est une dame de 31 ans  qui exerce le commerce depuis 10 ans .Elle est divorcée et n’a aucune charge. 
Elle vend de la friperie .Elle a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle a bénéficier d’un crédit de cent mille francs.
Avec le crédit elle veut acheter une balle de friperie.
Mme Maguette espère et souhaite agrandir son activité et ouvrir un magasin avec les bénéfices  acquis.
texts.en: Mrs Maguette is a 31 year olds woman who has been in the second-hand clothing business for 10 years. She is divorced and does not have responsibility for any other persons. She is a member of a loan group and has an individual loan of 100,000 francs. With this credit she hopes to purchase a bigger bag of second-hand clothes to re-sell. She hopes to, in the future, increase her activity and open a shop/stand with the profits from her sales.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mazoe, rice, sugar, and biscuits

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn mentioned that nowadays, life is difficult due to the high cost of commodities, school fees and transportation. Despite this, she has the strong determination to improve her status of living and support her family's needs. She is now 33 years old and has five school-aged children. She helps her husband in cultivating their farm land by planting corn and vegetables for sale. 

They aim to plant more vegetables to ensure high yields, but due to financial constraints, she is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production. They mentioned that this loan will help them to increase their production and income to educate all their children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. A major challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Nematali

texts.ru: Нематали женат и у него очень большая семья, он отец 8 детей. Для обеспечения своих детей  он начал заниматься купле- продажей скота. Более 10 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Кроме этого он выращивает зерновых культур. Он держит скот за счет кормов произведенных самим из своего земли. Он хочет получить займ для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота, а остальную сумму хочет использовать для покупки семян пшеницы и ячмень. На полученную прибыль он хочет улучшить благосостояние своего семьи.
texts.en:
Nematali is married and has an extremely large family: he is the father of eight children. In order to provide for his family, he began involved in reselling livestock. He's been active in this business for over ten years. Additionally, he grows grain crops. He feeds his animals from produce grown at his farm. 

Nematali is asking for a loan in order to buy three heads of large cattle and wheat and barley seeds. With the expected profits he hopes to increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Kenjegul's Group

texts.en:
Kenjegul is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and three daughters. The first son studies at university. The oldest daughter and the second son are at school, and the two younger daughters are preschool age (under seven). Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. Kenjegul’s husband sold two sheep and gained a good profit. And since that time, the family has been engaged in livestock breeding. With money received from the loan, Kenjegul wants to purchase four sheep for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future she wishes to build a big house and improve the family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Sa'eda

texts.en:
Sa'eda is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married with two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sa'eda wants to make some home decorations such as paintings and also wants to purchase some necessary home furniture such as living room furniture and a kitchen table, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $1,000 from FATEN. When Sa'eda gets the loan, she will pay to change her house by making necessary decorations and purchasing some new home furniture. This will offer her family better home living conditions. 

Sa'eda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

loans.use: to make home decorations and purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Mbako Shg Group

texts.en:
Alexanda is the facilitator of the Mbako group. Alexanda and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alexanda takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alexanda had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alexanda was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alexanda and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alexanda will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mbako group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to resell

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

Adel is a carpenter; in 2008 he decided to open his own workshop. He makes bedrooms and furniture. He has more than fifteen years' experience in this field, has a good reputation and is becoming well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

Thamer has been an owner of a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1800 loan in order to redecorate his market and to make a ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his food market and to make a ceiling

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is taking another Kiva loan of Ksh 40,000 to repair her DVD machine and radio, and to purchase household consumables. The previous loan has improved her living standards. She dreams of establishing a café business and to meet her children’s upkeep and their better education in the future. Since the last Kiva loan, her family has been able to provide better education, as well as enough food and clothing.

loans.use: To repair her DVD machine and radio, and to purchase household consumables.

loans.name: Shapanbubu's Group

texts.en:
Shapanbubu is the leader of this group.  She is 58, and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised three sons and six daughters. The youngest daughter and the youngest son study at school. The other children are married and live separately with their own families. In order to earn money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. 

Shapanbubu started this activity about twenty years ago and she got a lot of experience in this business. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she wishes to improve the family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives with her six children who are 20, 18, 15, 14, 12 and 8 years old. Razia runs a store where she sells basic household products. She has been in this business for many years. All her neighbors and friends from her area are customers. 

Her husband has a dairy business that provides him a decent income every month.   

Razia is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy oil, lentils, rice, spices, etc. This purchase will increase her stock and will help her to improve her customer service. 

Razia’s aspiration is to improve her business’s financial conditions, so she can provide better living facilities for her children and make them successful in their lives.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock for grocery store business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Mme Yacine est une jeune débutante dans le commerce car cela ne fait qu’un 1 an qu’elle s’est lancé. Elle est mariée .Son activité consiste à vendre des chaussures, des ventilateurs et tout autres produit qu’on lui commande
Avec le crédit Yacine veut renforcer son activité
Ces  bénéfices sont reversés dans l’ activité pour augmenter l’ offre.
texts.en:
A relative newcomer to business, Mme Yassin launched her activity one year ago. She is married. Her business consists of selling footwear, fans and any other products that customers may request
Yassin wants to use the loan to strengthen her business
Any profit will be reinvested into her business so that she can increase her product offering.

loans.use: to buy shoes and any other products likely to generate a profit

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has three children.

Haydar is a carpenter; in 2008 he decided to open his own workshop. He makes bedrooms and furniture. He has more than fifteen years' experience in this field, has a good reputation and is becoming well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase a wood-working machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a wood-working machine

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
To earn a living, Josie helps her husband in planting vegetables for sale. She is now 51 years old and has seven adult children. In farming, they experienced problems and difficulties due to typhoons or drought, but they are not discouraged in managing their farm lots for it is the major source of their income. Through their patience and hard work, most of their children have finished their educations. 

They aimed to increase their vegetable production to earn a higher income and to satisfy their basic necessities. She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in squash production. They hope that they will be having a fruitful harvest and give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in squash production

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are women. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals, cosmetics and braids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, cosmetics and braids.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун 15 лет занимается купле- продажей запчастей для автомашин. Он женат и является отцом шестерых детей. Семья большая и содержать семью нелегко. Следует создать все условия для воспитания и образования детей. Купля - продажа запчастей приносит хорошие доходы, но машины разных марок и следует закупать запчасти для всех видов автомашин. Турсун хотел бы получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и очень надеется на вашу помощь и великодушие. Он хочет получить займ в размере 5000 сомони и пополнить ассортимент товаров. Он благодарен за помощь в предоставлении займа.
texts.en: Tursun has been in the business of buying and selling auto parts for fifteen years. He is married and is a father of six children. His family is big and it's not easy to provide for it. He has to make best conditions for raising and educating his children. The buying and selling of auto parts brings good profit, but because there are different makes of cars he has to buy the parts for all kinds of vehicles. Tursun wants to take out a loan to expand his business and very much hopes for everyone's help and generosity. He wants to get a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to stock up on the variety of his products. He is thanking for your help and this loan in advance.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон способный молодой человек. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Дети маленькие. Содержать семью в достатке нелегко. Он трудолюбивый. Комилджон занимается евроремонтом квартир и частных домов. Это очень востребованный вид услуг. Он хочет получить 350 долларов США для приобретения орудия труда- перфоратора. Он надеется, то добрые люди отзовутся и протянут руку помощи. Он благодарен тем, кто предоставит ему займ для приобретения перфоратора. Спасибо.
texts.en: Komiljon is a capable young man. He is married and is a father of four children. His children are small. It is difficult to provide for the family in abundance. He is hardworking. Komiljon does remodeling of apartments and private homes. His services are in high demand. He wants to take out a loan in the amount of $350 USD to buy punching tools. He hopes that kind people will respond and lend a helping hand. He is thanking those who will provide him with the loan to buy the tools. Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase punching tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy millet for brewing local beer.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Mme Ramatoulaye est une dame qui fait du commerce depuis 8 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec sa belle- famille
Son activité consiste  à vendre des produits halieutiques dans le marché local. Elle a une expérience dans le domaine du crédit car elle est à sa  quatrième  fois.
Avec le prêt  elle veut  augmenter  ses possibilités d’offre et diversifier aussi ses produits.
texts.en:
Mme Ramatoulaye is a lady who has been in business for 8 years. She is married and lives with her in-laws
Her business consists of selling fish products in the local market. She already has experience in managing loans as this is her fourth loan cycle.
She wants to use the loan to increase her offering and diversify the products on sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, palm oil, smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cattle and goats to resell.

loans.name: Khaka Shg Group

texts.en:
Anthony is the facilitator of the Khaka SHG group. Anthony and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Anthony takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Anthony had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Anthony was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Anthony and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Anthony will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khaka SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 52-year-old married man with 15 children, living in Hioma, Uganda. The client deals in the buying and selling of maize and rice and has been doing this business for 15 years. The main challenge he faces is climatic change. His business goal is to expand his business and his personal goal is to educate his children. John needs a loan to buy maize and rice for resale.

loans.use: to purchase rice and maize for resale.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 26-year-old young woman, she is married with three sons and two daughters.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Fayza wants to purchase new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her children and living room furniture in order to positively improve her family life.  The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this so she needs to borrow a loan of $1,000 from FATEN.  When Fayza gets the loan, she will be able to positively change her home by purchasing new home furniture and this will provide her family with better living conditions.  Fayza is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has been involved in the agricultural business for almost twelve years. He is happy because he is able to manage his one hectare of rice fields. Bernard enjoys his farming activity, so he is determined to improve his rice production.  He is a young farmer and yet still single. 

Bernard's main priority is to prepare his farm land properly so that he can obtain a good rice crop.  Though he feels pain through the sun's heat still he endures it because he would like to help to provide for his family's living.  

Bernard would like to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields but his income is not enough to afford this.  So, for this reason, he is requesting financial assistance amounting to PHP 40,000.  He is hoping that this amount will help him to increase his yields and generate greater income to provide the basic necessities and save some money for security purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 40,000 to improve on her juice-making business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a fridge to store juice for sale. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for storing juice for sale.

loans.name: Tacuaree Poty Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de San Lorenzo se unieron 20 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, quienes desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas tienen como objetivo principal obtener mayores ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Una de ellas es la señora Zulma, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, negocio gracias al cual puede salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y muy emprendedora que siempre lucha por el bien de su familia y de todo quienes de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Twenty very hard-working and tenacious women meet in the city of San Lorenzo.  They wish to get ahead and to help their families by working together.  Their primary objective is to get greater income to help their children and family members.

Zulma is one of them.  She sells all types of clothing.  Thanks to this business she is able to get ahead and help her family.  She is known as a very hard-working and very enterprising woman. She always fights for her family’s well-being and for everyone who is dependent upon her.

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of clothing like shirts, pants, t-shirts, and more.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Namulanda Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the Namulanda B group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evans takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, access fertilizers and hybrid seeds and later educate his child. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Evans will rent more farmland for more production and educate his child.

In 2012, the members of Namulanda B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Evans is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  She is 38 years old, married to Ndungu and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm supplies. In the future, Mary hopes to improve her farming skills and make more profit, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet wants a loan to buy soap, sugar and rice for resale. She has been in this business for 4 years. She lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is 28 years old, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her child.  She desires to build a permanent home and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soap.

loans.name: Paul Kariuki

texts.en: Paul used his third loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use during the planting season, with very profitable results. Having repaid all previous loans well and in good time, he plans to use this fourth loan to again buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm. In the future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru: Зумрат активная и трудолюбивая девушка. Она не замужем. Более 4 года она занимается купле- продажей сувениров и подарочных изделий. У неё широкий ассортимент товаров и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Она планирует поехать за товарами в Китай и хочет поставлять красивые необычные сувениры и подарочные изделия, которые позволят ей привлечь много новых клиентов. Она запрашивает займ для закупа сувениров и подарочных изделий. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара к праздникам с целью получения больше дохода.
texts.en: Zumrad is an active and hard-working young woman. She is unmarried. For more than four years she has bought and sold souvenirs and gift items. She has a large assortment of goods and has many regular customers. She plans to go to China to buy goods and wants to supply beautiful, unusual souvenirs and gift items that will enable her to bring in many new customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase souvenirs and gift items. She wants to increase the range of her products for the holidays to bring in a higher income.

loans.use: purchase souvenirs and gift items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and lives in the airport community. She is a widow and she did not attend school. 

For the past 25 years she has been selling dried fish in the local market. She likes her business because it makes her independent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish (butter nose fish and cassava fish) for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish (butter nose fish and cassava fish) for her business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.
 
For the past six years, she has operated a business of selling stationery at a school compound to pupils and teachers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. The business is high during the first two months after opening of schools, then goes down in the later months as the school term is almost closing for holidays. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of marker pens, brown covers, polythene papers, manila sheets, staplers and staple pins. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of marker pens, brown covers, polythene papers, manila sheets, staplers and staple pins.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet wants a loan to buy salt, sugar and millet flour for sale. She has been in this business for three years. 

She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her one child. She desires to build a permanent home and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and millet flour for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed and harvest maize.

loans.name: Jack Kamau

texts.en:
Jack used his previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use during the planting season. He was able to plant and it was very profitable.

He paid the loan amount and all the previous loan amounts well and in good time. He plans to use the new loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as to buy spray chemicals for use in his farm during this planting season.

In the future, Jack hopes to start zero grazing and venture into milk production, hence becoming one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Asmaa'

texts.en:
Asmaa' is a 23-year-old young woman, she is married and has one son and two daughters.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Asmaa' wants to purchase some home furniture that she doesn't have at home such as a kitchen table and living room furniture but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this so she needs to borrow a loan from FATEN.  When Asmaa' gets the loan she will be able to buy the furniture she wants which will have a positive effect on her life and she will offer to her family a better home. Asmaa' is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed here instead.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her home.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith owns a boutique in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 55 and is a single mother of three children. 

She has owned the boutique for two years and dreams of a modern one that caters to all people. She wants another loan to buy clothes for resale ahead of the festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aichurek's Group

texts.en:
Aichurek is the leader of this group. She is 60 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons. The older son is a carpenter and the second son works in Russia. 

Ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Aichurek started cultivating and selling agricultural products. In this way she earns about 5,000 KGS per month. She mostly cultivates potatoes and apples. 

With money received from the loan, Aichurek plans to purchase apples in order to resell them at a higher price to gain some profit. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to construct rental houses

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the outbreak of poultry disease. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. He is 54 years old, married to Njoki, and they have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock like maize flour, tea leaves and salt for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, Wilson hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and make more profits, hence improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize flour,  tea leaves and salt  for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder for use in his welding business.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is a responsible and hard working parent. He is married and has one child. He didn't finish his degree course due to financial difficulties. Despite his experiences, he bears in mind that he needs to continue aiming for his dreams. Johnny is aiming to increase his rice production in order to have a plentiful harvest this crop season. Aiming for bigger dreams is not an easy thing said Johnny, because you will be enduring hardships and difficulties. 

Johnny is asking for a loan amount of P35,000 which will be used to pay for the labor cost of tilling the farm land and to buy farm materials in order to improve the growth of rice crops. This would really help him in sustaining family needs.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of tilling farm land and to buy farm materials to improve the growth of rice crops.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 23 years old, married to Jane, and they have one child.

Introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, Zachary is requesting his first loan in order to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop. In future, he hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale operation, earn more income, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: From Kyenjojo District, Francis is a 39-year-old father of four children between the ages  of 11 and 2, all of whom he wishes to give a good education to. Having inherited land from his father, Francis planted a sugar cane plantation of six acres and started brewing alcohol from the sugar cane.  Now requesting a loan to purchase waragi, a local brew, to resell, he dreams of building a permanent residential house and expanding his business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for resale.

loans.name: Progressive C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Progressive C Group in Western Kenya! Truphosa is the facilitator of the Progressive C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Truphosa takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Truphosa had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Truphosa was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Truphosa and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Truphosa will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Progressive C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Truphosa with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kahanda Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Fred wants a loan to buy maize produce for resale. Aged 49 years, Fred hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda. He is a father of six children and he lives with them and their mother in a semi permanent house. Having started by growing pineapples, Fred saved money to start up that business, which has grown over four years. His dream is to educate his children and he hopes to acquire a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking young married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop that she started three years ago.  She meets the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, plus customers who do not pay on time.  Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home.  Her business goal is to expand her business into a wholesale shop. Sarah needs the loan to buy cassava flour, match boxes and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, match boxes, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид женат и ответственный отец шестерых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается торговлей. Он продает запасные части автомобиля. Он имеет много клиентов, потому что он всегда привозит высококачественные товары. Абдурашид запрашивает займ для покупки товаров с целью расширения бизнеса и увлечения ассортимента запчастей. Он работает усердно для того, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия семьи и обеспечения своих детей. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и с нетерпением ждет одобрение займа. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Abdurashid is a married, responsible father of six. For more than 10 years he has been a trader. He sells spare car parts. He has many customers because he  always brings in high quality goods. Abdurashid is asking for a loan to buy goods in order to grow his business and increase the range of his spare parts. He has been working diligently to improve the living conditions of his family and provide for his children. He looks forward to your support and waits for the approval of the loan. He thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been in the quarry business of extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last 3 years.  She is 24 years old, married to John, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be her 1st loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy quarrying tools and equipments so that she may increase her production and income.  In the future, Susan hopes to expand and own many quarries.

loans.use: To buy quarry tools and equipments

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 46-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He started from brick laying  and managed to get enough income to start a pub, which he has now operated for six years.  In his business, he has faced the following hardships: price fluctuation, inflation, and customers not paying on time.  His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home.  John needs the loan to buy beers and spirits to sell this Christmas Season.

loans.use: to buy beers and spirits to sell this Christmas season

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 30,000 to improve her charcoal selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Thanks for Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina used the previous loan to pay fees for her children.  In her business of a clothing shop, she still faces a challenge of limited capital, price fluctuations, and inflation.  Amina intends to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Nyabukara Banywani Group

texts.en:
Michael is a 37-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He owns a business of used shoes, which he started three years ago with capital worth 390,000 UGX but now it is worth 2 million UGX.

His challenges include high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations, seasonal weather and taxes levied on him.

His business goal is to expand his business into new markets. 

Michael needs the loan to buy 60 pairs of shoes for sale this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Phelogona

texts.en:
Phelogona is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years, she has operated a clothing selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the low number of customers that turn out. She dreams of establishing a retail shop to sell her clothes in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He has a hotel that he started six years ago. In Africa the term "hotel" often means a basic restaurant. He faces challenges of high fuel and transportation costs and seasonal weather.

His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car. 

Francis needs the loan to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 48-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has a produce business that she started three years ago. She started with one million UGX but now her business is worth 3 million.

Her challenge is high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goal is building a permanent home.

Resty needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle, which has enabled him to support his eight household members.

Since it has been his desire to own many motorcycles, Robert needs the loan to buy a second motorcycle for transportation and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year.  He is 47 years old, married to Margaret, and has four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Laban hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and later open a supermarket, thereby becoming one of the leading businessmen in the area.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Angellica

texts.en:
Angellica is a 35-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started by farming and saved money to start a clothing business. Her challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to meet the different tastes of her customers. 

Her personal goals are to educate her children and to build a permanent home.

Angellica needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been collecting and spinning wool in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 42 years old and married to Jane. They have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more machines for his wool collection and spinning business.

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business and open a textile business. He hopes to become the best textile distributor in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy more machines.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 40,000 to improve his business. 

With the loan, he wants to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts, and mangoes to boost his fruit selling business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts, and mangoes.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 39-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started with a retail shop and got capital to start a clothing shop seven years ago. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal customers. 

Her personal goals are to educate her children and to buy a car. 

Rosette needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monica lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a cereals shop, a business that has been in operation for four years. She is widowed and has four children none of whom are in school. She also owns rental houses.
Monica is applying for a loan of Ksh 10,000 to purchase additional stock of rice.
She learnt about Milango from the staff and joined in order to access credit. The main challenge in her business is  price fluctuations.  The income from this business enables Monica to support her extended family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 41-year-old married man, father of two beautiful children. Yasser is a hardworking man who expands his business through introducing his customers to new products. He started as a grocery store in 1996, then he started adding new products to his shop such as gifts and selling espresso coffee. Doing this helped a lot in improving his social and financial situation. Yasser's shop is next to a hospital which is an important spot for any business to improve, and because of this important zone he is working in, he started making and selling sandwiches, which has attracted most of the hospital's visitors and staff.

Yasser is requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new products with special offers.
This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he hopes to be as good a borrower as he is a good business man.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new products with special offers

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and two siblings. One of them is working in addition to his mother who’s the main income provider in the family. Unlike others in his age, Abbass started to work very early expecting to help his mother with their expenses and he succeeded. He’s now working on a free-lance basis as plumber, and he has a fair number of clients asking for his services. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and equipment for his business. Abbass notes that he’s willing to take on bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him to achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for his business

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi, age 22, is married to Mariam and they have one child. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, Kahindi has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With the Kshs 5,000 loan, Kahindi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 56 year-old man who is married with one son.  He is a taxi driver with a low income. Talal wants to make necessary repairs to his taxi such as: changing the doors, painting, changing the taxi tires, etc.  but he doesn't have enough to do this, so he needs to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Talal gets the loan, he will pay the expenses of making the necessary repairs to the taxi, this will increase the taxi efficiency and enable Talal to work extra hours to increase his income and provide to his family better living conditions. Talal is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is single and has been selling ladies’ accessories around Mombasa for four years.

Elias is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 in order to purchase more ladies’ jewelry, bags, and clothes. He learned about Milango Financial Services through a promotion and is committed to acquire and repay loans through Milango.

Since Elias does not own a stall, he has to forgo selling when it rains. He looks forward to doing business even more energetically and to earning more income in order to establish a stall. This will also enable him support his extended family, which depends on him.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies’ jewelry, bags, and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc.

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
Mbwana is 42, married, and has six children. Five of his children attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past three years, Mbwana has operated a palm wine business, selling at wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.  He dreams of expanding his business and hiring employees in the future.

With a loan of KES 10,000, Mbwana wants to start a vegetable stall business by purchasing bundles of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 30-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is a father of three children. Two of the children are still in primary school and the youngest is two years old. Mohammed completed only primary school and could not go ahead with his study due to the difficult living conditions he faced.

Mohammed's business is a grocery store that he started 14 years ago with limited capital and income. By sticking with his business, which is the main source for feeding his family, Mohammed was able to attract new clients. This had an impact on expanding his business capital and income. Mohammed was happy for the increase in clients but on the other hand, Mohammed faced a financial challenge because he was not able to meet the demands of his clientele.

Mohammed took a loan of 400,000 YER from Al Amal Bank in order to meet the demands of his clients by providing the needed grocery goods. It is worth mentioning that Mohammed is one of the trusted clients of AMB, as this loan is the third loan to be disbursed to him.

In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business and capital by opening another grocery as well as purchasing a truck, which he will use to pick up goods from wholesalers to deliver to his grocery. He also is saving to enroll his youngest child in a private school to guarantee a good education.

loans.use: to purchase goods and requirements for his grocery store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a barber shop that has been open for four months. He also doubles as a security guard at Kenya Ports Authority. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Having seen an increase of clients to his business, Ali has decided to restock some barber-shop materials, including shaving machines and spirits, to increase the operations. 

He is therefore applying for a loan of 40,000 KES. He believes that the increased income from the loan will enable him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase barber-shop materials, including shaving machines and spirits.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 33-year-old Lebanese single man living with his one parent and seven siblings. Two of his siblings are still attending school and three others are working. In cooperation with his siblings, Bilal is responsible for paying his siblings' educational fees in addition to all other family expenses. He has been working in wall foliage for the past five years and is waiting for the perfect time to grow in this field. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage shop.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
Hakima is a 52-year-old widow who has been able to raise her three sons to become successful young men by buying and selling used clothes. Her business is based at home.
In addition to the clothing business, Hakima's sons have a painting hobby. They even have a special room in the house where they keep all their painting tools. They asked their mom to sell their paintings to contribute to the household income. 
Now Hakima has applied for a loan to buy new clothes to add to her stock of used clothes and her sons' paintings.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and four siblings. He has one working sibling while three others are still attending school. Ahmad achieved his third year in hotel management at a local university and is seeking to pursue his master's degree. For this reason, he’s requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees in order to be able to continue his education properly. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans with the ambition to pursue higher university degrees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is 21 years old. She is married to a military man and has two children. A year ago, Wisam started a small retail business. At first, it involved buying and selling accessories, then clothes, and now blankets as a preparation for the winter season.
Wisam is looking forward to expanding her business so she can help to support the family while they are young. She wants to provide her children with a comfortable life while they are growing up. In order to do that, Wisam has applied for this loan to purchase more products to sell in larger quantities and at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армену 26 лет; он живет в  городе Капане. После окончания капанской средней школы, Армен поступил и окончил в Ереванский Государственный Университет (факультет радиофизики).
В данный момент Армен работает электриком и проживает в селе Цав, Сьюникского региона. Армен не женат и  живет вместе с родителями. 
Сельскохозяйственным бизнесом Армен и его семья занимается уже на протяжении 7 лет. У них есть небольшой собственный участок, а также арендованный земельный участок, на которых они выращивает яблоки, груши, картошку и капусту на продажу. Кроме растениеводства, Армен и его семья занимаются животноводством: разводят крупный рогатый скот и кур.   
Вместе с родителями Армен реализует выращенные овощи на рынках Сьюникской области, а мясо, молоко, яйца, фрукты и оставшиеся овощи у него покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома.
Армену нужен кредит в 1.000.000 армянских драм, для покупки  нового сорта картофеля для засева и организации посевных работ (покупки дизельного топлива, удобрений и т.д.).
texts.en: Armen is 26 years old; he lives in Kapan. After finishing middle school in Kapan, Armen entered and graduated from Yerevan State University (Radiophysics Department). At this time, Armen works as an electrician and lives in the village of Tsav in the Syunik province. Armen is unmarried and lives with his parents. Armen and his family have been in agriculture for the past 7 years. They have their own small piece of land and lease some more land, on which they grow apples, pears, potatoes and cabbage for sale. Besides growing crops, Armen and his family raise livestock, raising cattle and chickens. With his parents, Armen sells the vegetables in the Syunik regional market, but his regular customers buy meat, milk, eggs, fruit and vegetables directly from his home. Aren is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 dram to buy new varieties of potatoes to sow and to prepare for the sowing season (purchase diesel fuel, fertilizer, etc.)

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a water-selling business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to repair a water tap for her water-distribution business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to repair a water tap for her water-distribution business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who started his business with the help of his family seven years ago. He runs a mini market that sells mostly snacks and some basic food products such as sugar, salt, etc. Now he has applied for a loan to buy more food products so he can expand his business and is able to serve more people.

loans.use: to buy more food products for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair spray, artificial hair, hair polish, shampoo, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 31 year-old young woman who is married and has two sons and two daughters, her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Samaher wants to purchase some new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for her children, living room furniture, etc. but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she would like to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Samaher gets the loan, she will change the life of her family positively by purchasing what they need to make their living conditions better. Samaher is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en: Edmond is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his one parent and brother. He is working very hard to earn a living despite all the difficulties he faces. In 2010, Edmond opened his own amusement shop and is looking forward to enlarging the shop. Today, he needs to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new games and supplies for his business. He notes that this loan will motivate children and adults to come and spend time at the shop. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and install new and bigger games.

loans.use: to purchase new games and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is 49 years old and works in a home-based retail business with her husband. The couple have bought and sold clothes for the last three years in order to support their family. Yusra is depending on word of mouth to spread the news about her business, and until now she has been satisfied with the number of customers. But now she wants to increase customer numbers by offering more and different styles of clothes for different ages. Her product source is in Aqaba, so every once in a while she goes from Irbid to the free zone area in Aqaba to buy clothes cheaply. Sher returns to Irbid to sell them at a higher price, but less than the market value.
Now Yusra has applied for a loan to purchase more winter clothes at he beginning of the season.

loans.use: to buy more winter clothes at he beginning of the season.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. Samuel is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for eight years. He is mainly faced with challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, which has resulted in high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. Samuel needs a loan to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to build a permanent house.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 18 years old and has passed her high school exams to enter a Jordanian college. Her dream is to study Social Services Studies, so she has registered to get her diploma/degree. Yasmeen has applied for this loan in order to pay her tuition fees so she can continue her studies. 
Because she is conservative person, Yasmeen asked her mother, who supported her to finish high school and choose a suitable major, to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay her college tuition fees.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 58-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. In 2007, she decided to open her own home appliances shop. Today, she’s asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products so she can boost her productivity and her income. In the future, she plans to search for new and high-tech products in order to please more of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional products.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man with four children living in Hioma, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling beans and groundnuts. He has been doing this business for 12 years. The main challenges he faces are fluctuating prices and inflation. His business goal is to expand his business and be able to save more for the future. His personal goals are to improve his standard of living and educate his children. William needs a loan to buy groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Masika has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Additionally, she also operates a motorcycle business, which contributes to her income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to pay for the school fees for her child who attends primary school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child who attends primary school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the old home furniture by purchasing new one.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a married man, 29 years old, with one child. His main business is electrical appliances and he has been doing it for four years. The main challenge in the business is customers not paying back on time. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets and his personal goal is to build a permanent home.
