Brian needs a loan to procure mobile phones to boost his business.

loans.use: To procure mobile phones.

loans.name: Newlife Group

texts.en:
Keresencia is a 60 year old lady and she is a widow. She has 4 children ages 41, 37, 35, and 32 years. She also has 12 dependants who are her orphaned grandchildren.

Keresencia operates a vegetable stall at Nyika Growth Point. She has been in the business for 20 years. She buys her products from Harare and masvingo. She has two employees who work for her. The challenge she faces in the business is that her products have a cost that is high as she can not take advantage of bulk buying. In the next five years, she would like to have a shop with a refrigerator so that the vegetables do not perish due to high temperatures. With the profits from the business she will be able to take care of her ophaned grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, apples, cabbages, and oranges.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 26-year-old lady who has a small retail business at home. She sells home products, mainly to her friends and neighbors.
Amani started this business in order to help and contribute to her family’s income. Now she want buy more products to increase her sales and that is why she has applied for this loan.
Since Amani is a conservative person, she asked her brother-in-law Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to add more home products to her range.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old single Lebanese man. He’s the only child of his parents and they’re all living together. He’s a hard worker, ambitious and caring for his parents' situation, or else he would not provide any help for his family. They’re really thankful for having such a man. 

Mohamad has owned his own coffee booth since 2009, and until now he’s taking advantage of every single moment to benefit and develop his business. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $3000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to open his own cafe. He’s well known for his delicious coffee, and having his own place will increase his revenues. 

In the future, he plans to open his own restaurant just next to the cafe.

loans.use: To open his own cafe.

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 33ans , célibataire et mère d'un enfant, elle s'est lancée dans la restauration depuis 2009.
elle a deja bénéficié de 3 prêts et elle a remboursé sans défauts de paiements.. 
Dans le soucis d'élargir son restaurant , elle est  prit un autre prêt.
ses revenus par jour sont de 160.000f et elle épargne toujours durant les réunions de remboursements.
avec l'actuel prêt, elle va acheté  en gros  les aliments tels que:  3cartons de cuisses de poulets, 2cartons de viandes, 2cartons de poissons salés, 1 de 50kg panier de poissons fumés, 1 bidon de 25l d'huile , 1 sac de 50kg sac de riz, 1 carton de tomates en boîte, 1 barbecue , les condiments( oignons, cubes, poivres blanc , poivre noir, piment, ail ); et les chaises en plastiques.
Son souci est de faire  des grillades et des menus à emportés , sa clientèle augmente car les services  sont très acceptables.
Elle épargne et veut  ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne pour atteindre son objectif:acheté une parcelle et contribuer à l'éducation de son fils .
texts.en:
This client is 33 years old, single and the mother of one child. She launched a restaurant business back in 2009.
She already had three prior loans and repaid them without delay. Her daily revenues are about 160,000 Francs and she always saves in between loan payments. With the current loan, she will purchase some grocery items wholesale, such as: three boxes of chicken legs, two boxes of meat, two boxes of salted fish, one 50-kg basket of smoked fish, one 25-liter jug of  oil, one 50-kg bag of rice, one box of canned tomatoes, one barbecue [grill], condiments (onions, [sauce] cubes, white pepper, black pepper, pimento, garlic) as well as plastic chairs.

Her aim is to make grilled dishes and take-away foods. Her customer base is growing because her services are affordable. She puts money away as savings and would like to open a more modern restaurant in order to achieve her goal: to buy a   plot of land and  support her son’s education.

loans.use: achats :carton (cuisses, poisson sale, viande de boeuf), 1panier de poisson fumé, 1bidon d'huile, 1sac de riz, , 1carton de tomates en boîte,1barbacue, 20chaises en plastiques et quelque ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 41-year-old housewife who has seven sons and daughters. Two years ago, she opened an extended room from her house as a small food market to help her husband to support their large family. With the profits that she made during those two years, she was able to enhance her food market by adding more shelves and more food products.
Now Kefa wants to apply for a loan to buy new types of food products that she was not able to buy before.

loans.use: to buy new types of food products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sausage processing machine.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for his shop such as agro inputs.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and five siblings. One of them is still studying at university while all the family collaborate together to be able to cover their needs.

Asmaa has owned a scarves shop since 2010 and trying always to follow trendy and fashionable items. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of new scarves for the coming holidays. She notes that this will raise her sales to gain superior revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own scarves factory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of new scarves .

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 42-year-old widow who was left to raise six sons and daughters by herself. Three years ago, she started a retail business at home to sell clothes and shoes (as shown in the picture). She even added home and kitchen products to her range as per customers' requests.
With her business profits, Hala was able to buy more products through the years and was even able to see her son married. Now Hala has applied for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes, so she can increase her profits and open a separate store instead of selling from her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, televisions, and radios.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new home furniture to improve her home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his five siblings and parents. Ali’s family members joined forces and they are more than happy for being such a supportive, helpful and collaborative family just to be able to cover the heavy costs of life and pay their two school-aged childrens’ fees. 

Ali has ten years’ experience in the agriculture field and started his own business as a farmer in 2005. He takes good care of his land and he’s sure that it will return on him with excellent and natural fruits and vegetables. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new agriculture supplies for his tractor. In the future, he plans to buy new land and expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase new agriculture supplies for his tractor.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en: Esha is taking another Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her motorcycle business. With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She also operates a fruit juice making business which she earns her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more employees in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 39-year-old housewife who is married and has four children. At home she has always had an old sewing machine. She used to use some fabric to make items of clothing for her family until almost two years ago when she turned this activity into a small home business, sewing and making clothes and curtains. 
Now Ahlam has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, DVDs, TVs, shoes, satellite dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy breakfast cereals for Chevron Hotel.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents, two siblings who are still attending school and four others working. With his siblings’ backing, he finds it much easier responding to his family needs and demands. He decided to start his own business as a constructor in 2006, after being involved in this domain for the previous ten years. 

Ahmad is working really hard to serve his customers as quickly as he can. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects, outside and inside the country.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and a fridge for storing milk to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and a fridge for storing milk to sell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 30-year-old housewife who has three children with her husband Anwar, who works in a factory. Laila and her husband have built a small storage room where they manufacture types of tobacco to be used for Arabian Shisha. After making the tobacco, her husband delivers it to shops and cafés in their area.
Now Laila want to buy some specialist equipment and machines for making these types of tobacco. In the future, she wants to expand and have her own factory. 
because Laila is a conservative person, her husband Anwar has agreed to take the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy some specialist equipment and machines for making tobacco.

loans.name: Gerges

texts.en:
Gerges is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. Two of the children are working, while two others are still attending school. Gerges is the main source of income in the family and he has big and serious responsibilities. 

Gerges has been working as a farmer for the past eleven years; he really loves farming and wishes to spend the rest of his life working on his land. Today, he needs to borrow $2000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a mini van, which will help him transport his products in the fastest way. In the future, he plans to work with high tech materials in order to grow up his land.

loans.use: to purchase a mini van.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy day-old chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks, and medicines.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. He is the main income provider in his family, and mentioned that his wife tries her best to take some responsibilities. 

Abdallah is working as a cameraman. He has owned a studio since 1980 and he’s an expert in his job. He also sells movies.
 
As for his wife, she has been working as a teacher in a local school for the past eleven years. 

Abdallah is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new equipment for his business such as cables, stands, films, and many other items. 

In the future, he plans to increase his revenues in order to enlarge his shop.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business such as cables, stands, films and many other items.

loans.name: Aviud De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Aviud a sus 49 años de edad, es propietario de una tienda ubicada en el occidente de la ciudad de Medellín, en la cual trabaja hace tres años. El señor Aviud tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15  años de edad. La tienda le provee los ingresos con los cuales puede llevar la responsabilidad de su hogar. El señor Aviud desea comprar surtido como papel higiénico, legumbres, snakcs, dulces, aceite, arroz, café, entre otros productos con los cuales aumente su inventario y pueda generar mayores ingresos. El señor Aviud desea tener su propio mini mercado para generar empleos directos en su comunidad y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Aviud is 49 years old and owns a shop located in the west part of the city of Medellin, where he has worked for the last 3 years. Señor Aviud has 2 children aged 8 and 15 years. His shop is his source of income with which he covers the household expenses. Señor Aviud wants to buy a variety of products such as toilet paper, vegetables, snacks, pastries, oil, rice and coffee amongst others with which to increase his inventory and generate more income. Señor Aviud wants to have his own minimart to generate jobs for the community and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as toilet paper, fruit and vegetables, pastries, oil and coffee.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 44-year-old woman who is married to Adnan, who is recently retired. They have six sons and daughters, one of whom is already married.
After her husband's retirement, Asmahan bought a toy and children’s accessories shop for her and her husband to work in. It has been only two months since they started, but they are very optimistic about their shop and want to expand it to include more and more rare toys. Therefore, Asmahan has applied for this loan to decorate the shop and buy more toys.
Because Asmahan is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to decorate her toy shop and buy more toys.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is taking another Kiva loan of Kshs 20,000 to improve her motorcycle business and also start a charcoal selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle and purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. 

She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ demand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working. Despite his older age, he is still courageous and brave, searching for a better life for his family.

He has owned a mini market in his town for the past 28 years. He has a good reputation and a fair number of loyal clients.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one. He notes that this Kiva loan will help him increase his business sales thus his income. 

In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque lleva por nombre el grupo integrado por 25 mujeres D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, las cuales son todas amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el deseo D. progresar y D. salir adelante, ya que ellas desean darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y familiares. Se definen como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy honestas.
Una D. esas mujeres muy trabajadoras es la señora Caren, quien con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a la venta D. sabanas que hace, ha podido ir creciendo y salir adelante. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buena venta pues ya tiene una clientela formada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. más sabanas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más en stock, con lo que podrá cumplir con sus clientes, agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
San Roque is the name of the group which consists of 25 women from the city of San Lorenzo, all of whom are friends and neighbours from the same city. They got together with the desire to progress and get ahead as they wish to give their children and families a better future. They describe themselves as determined, hardworking and very honest women.

One of these hardworking women is Señora Caren who with a lot of effort and thanks to her sales of sheets, has been able to grow and get ahead. She says that she is doing very well as she has very good sales due to an established client base. She is asking for the loan to buy more sheets with which to stock up and have more in stock as well as be able to meet her customers' demands. She is grateful to both Kiva and the Fundacion for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy sheets for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for the shop.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He supports his brother, their main source of income, in order to satisfy their family's needs and to enrich their way of living. 

Alaa has owned a vegetables shop since 2007 and he is looking forward to grow up his business. Today, he needs to borrow $1200 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new products for his shop. This will certainly boost his productivity and augment his profits. In the future, he plans to deliver vegetable to the suburbs.

loans.use: to purchase new products for his shop.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 40-year-old mother of six sons and daughters. Tamam and her husband Bassam work together selling clothes, blankets, and small electronics.
They have been running this retail business for the last four years.
Now Tamam has applied for a loan to add more products to their range in order to expand and reach more areas. In the future, they hope to open a separate store.
Because Tamam is a conservative person, her husband Bassam has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and products for resale.

loans.name: Thumu

texts.en: Thumu is taking another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost her business. With the loan she wants to add more stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and oil. She dreams of expanding her business to satisfy her customers' needs in the future. Thumu is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her this loan to boost her business and to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. This couple strives to work really hard to spend the rest of their life properly. Joseph has owned a mini market since 2005 and he is waiting for the perfect time to enlarge his shop. As for his wife, she has been working as a teacher in a local school. 

Today, Joseph is looking to borrow $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added supplies to enlarge the business. In the future, he notes that he will collect money, take a rest and retire to hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase added supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a sewing machine, cloth materials and threads for her tailoring business. She dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future. Her first Kiva loan has helped and improved her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, cloth materials, threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Claudia Marcela

texts.es: La señora Claudia a sus 39 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad, uno de los cuales sufre de una enfermedad llamada Epilepsia y la cual para su tratamiento requiere de medicamentos muy costosos. La señora Claudia se dedica hace dos años a la decoración de alcobas para bebe y canecas para decorar habitaciones. Este oficio lo aprendió de su esposo con quien hoy en día no vive con ella. La señora Claudia desea comprar materia prima como pintura, lacas, barniz y juegos de alcoba para poder aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia y a futuro tener un almacén y casa propia.
texts.en: Señora Claudia at her 39 years of age is the mother of 2 children, 18 and 13 years of age, one of whom suffers from epilepsy and needs expensive medicine to treat it. Señora Claudia decorates bedroom suites for babies and makes decorations for rooms. She learned this trade from her husband with whom she no longer lives. Señora Claudia wants to buy raw materials such as paints, varnishes and bedrooms sets so as to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life and in the future have a store and her own house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as paints, varnishes and a bedroom suite.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are all working. Unlike other women in her place, she’s the one responsible for her family and is their main income source. Amina strives to work really hard and doesn't hesitate to offer help whenever anyone needs it. Since 2003, she has owned a mini market where she also sells vegetables. Her business has succeeded, especially after being very welcoming and friendly. Today, she wants to borrow $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplementary products to be able to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open a snack shop next to her mini market.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products.

loans.name: Mwango

texts.en:
Mwango, age 38, is married and lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a business selling palm wine to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the 10,000 KES, he wants to purchase coconuts for making palm wine for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for making palm wine for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife, parents and one sibling. Ali happily helps support his father, and they’re both covering the family's needs and expenses. He has been working on his own for the past four years. His job consists of transporting cars in his tow truck so they may be fixed. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his shuttle. This loan will allow him to carry on his job properly. In the future, he plans to have his own house and children.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 27, is married and has two children, both of whom are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a business selling palm wine to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase coconuts to make palm wine. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to make palm wine.

loans.name: Cerro Poty Group

texts.es:
Las señoras del comité Cerro Poty, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación y con kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que les da. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, quienes trabajan muy a gusto dentro del programa, quieres salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
La presidenta, la Sra. María Lourdes vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de confites, es decir de masitas dulces, tiene su negocio en el centro de la cuidad de Caacupé. Comenta que tiene buena venta, y nos dice que una de sus metas es seguir creciendo para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su marido para mantener la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, dulces y demás insumos con los cuales elabora los confites que vende. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The women of Cerro Poty Committee are hard working people. They are very grateful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity of progress that they have given them. Currently it is made up of 15 women who work very happily in the program and want to get ahead and thus help their families.
The president, María Lourdes, lives with her husband and children. She sells sweets for a living, i.e. sweet pastries. She has her business in the downtown of the city of Caacupé. She comments that she has good sales and tells us that one of her goals is to continue growing so that in this way she can continue helping her husband to keep the house.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, sweets and additional ingredients which produce the sweets that she sells. She, together with her partners, constantly conduct activities and thereby promote integration among the partners and try to continue with their payments.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, sweets and additional ingredients.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old and is married with two children aged between five and six years old. Her business is very clean and good. She sells various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, etc. She has two years experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business is open from 6am until 8pm everyday except on Sunday. 

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profit from the loan, Beatrice will expand her business and save money for her family.

loans.use: to expand her boutique by buying various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Natalia Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia nació en la  ciudad del Lima y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Claudia tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. 

Claudia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco. Desde hace 12 años que trabaja en una tienda de venta de repuestos de carro pero actualmente Claudia se independizo y tiene su propio negocio. Ya son seis meses que se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carro de forma independiente. 

Claudia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Claudia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por amortiguadores, sistema de refrigeración, amortiguadores, soportes, pistones y otras cosas más. 

Claudia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudia was born in the city of Lima and now lives in Cusco. Claudia is 37 years old and has two children.
Claudia conducts her daily and economic activity in the city of Cusco. For 12 years she has worked in a store that sells car parts but now Claudia has gone independent and started her own business. She has sold car parts independently for a living for 6 months now.
Claudia belongs to the communal bank, “Ñahupacman Purisun” of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco. Claudia needs this loan buy goods such as shocks, cooling systems, shock absorbers, struts, pistons and other things.
Claudia is thankful for the opportunity afforded by this means and likewise promises to comply with the corresponding payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy goods such as shocks, cooling systems, shock absorbers, struts, pistons and other things.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia Juana; sigue atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes y ella en esta ocasion requiere el prestamo  para invertir en la compra de champan, vino, panetones, galletas, productos de primera necesidad como harinas, azucar, arroz, leche, chocolate entre otros productos de salida diaria y ahora que esta cerca la navidad la socia implementara sus tienda de abarrotes con panetones, vino, champan, chocolates, y otros productos. La socia desea ampliar a futuro su tienda y también vender adornos, peluches, regalos, un poco de libreria en mercaderia basica como lapiceros, papeles de escritorio entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de champan, azucar, arroz, chocolate, vino, panetones y otros.
texts.en: The member, Juana, continues operating her grocery store and on this occasion she requires a loan to invest in the purchase of champagne, wine, panettones , cookies, and staples such as flours, sugar, rice, milk and chocolate among other products of daily output. Now that Christmas is near, the member will stock her grocery store with panettones, wine, champagne, chocolates and other products. The associate wants to expand her store in the future and also to sell decorations, stuffed animals, gifts, a small library of basic goods such as pens and stationary among other things. The member requests the loan to invest in the purchase of champagne, sugar, rice, chocolate, wine, panettones and others.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Christmas items.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 7. One of his children goes to school. 

Adam runs a mixed food store business, and he has been in the business for seven years. He has one employee. Adam is requesting a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase items like powdered milk, powdered orange juice, sugar, etc. Adam has no other source of income. 

In five years' time, Adam hopes to have two food markets. His major challenge is paying for home expenses.

Adam wishes to thank Kiva for supporting people's lives and families in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase items like powdered milk, powdered orange juice, sugar, etc. for his food store.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa nació en la  ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Carmen Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Carmen Rosa desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Carmen Rosa se dedica a la venta de libros de forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de lunes y sábados. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Carmen Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar libros y revistas. 

Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 38 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has three children.  Carmen Rosa carries out her daily and business activities in the city of Cusco.

Carmen Rosa works selling books as a street vendor.  She works from 9 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon from Monday through Saturday.  She has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Carmen Rosa belongs to Ñahupacman Purisun Communal Bank, of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She needs the loan to buy books and magazines.

Carmen Rosa is grateful for the opportunity offered by this loan, and she also is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy books and magazines.

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en:
Rickson, 38, is a married man with eight children, seven of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fourteen years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also owns real estate houses, which provide another source of income. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Solidario Las Sunamitas Group

texts.es: Solidario Las Sunamitas: Este Grupo Esta conformado por doña francisca ella es una persona que es muy responsabñe muy luchadora,ella se dedica a la venta y a la confeccion de tejidos tipicos lleva ya 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque a parte de ser un motivo de entrada economica le ayuda a cuidar a sus hijos porque ella confecciona en su casa,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos,al igual que la siguentes socias estan solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos.
texts.en: One of the members of the Solidarity Group Las Sunamitas is Doña Francisca, a very responsible and hard-struggling woman. She weaves and sells typical fabrics. She has had this activity for eight years and is very happy with it for two reasons: it gives her an income and she can care for her children while weaving because she works at home. She applies for this loan to buy raw material for weaving. Similarly, her fellow group members need a loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Danila

texts.es: La socia Daniela; actualemnte sigue con el negocio de los cueros, ella produce cartearas, bolsos, monederos, carutcheras, billeteras, la socia trabaj comprando cuero al por mayor y en todo grosor, la socia tambien compra cuero ya trabajado como los de color entre otros materiales para poder fabricar, carteras, la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de carteras, monedoros entre otros articulos, la socia es ambulante y ella desea tener un talelr bien implementado y poder tambien exhibir su mercaderia, ella trabaja muy duro para apoyar en casa a la educacion y a la mejor calidad de sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de carteras, monederos, billeteras entre otros productos en base a cuero.
texts.en:
Daniela continues with her leather business. She manufactures small bags, bags, coin purses, pencil cases and wallets. She buys wholesale leather of various types, as well as processed and dyed leather and other raw materials for manufacturing her bags. 
This time, Daniela wants to use her loan for purchasing the materials needed for manufacturing bags, purses and other products. She is a street vendor but wants to have a fully set workshop where she can also exhibit her products. She works very hard in order to support her children's education and quality of life. 
Daniela is asking for this loan to purchase raw materials needed for manufacturing leather bags, purses and wallets.

loans.use: purchase raw materials for manufacturing bags, purses, wallets and other products made of leather

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 25 year-old businessman, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 1. Neither goes to school. 

Henry runs a mixed-food store, and he has been in the business for 6 years. He has one employee. Henry heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase items like powdered milk, tang juice, sugar, rice and many others. 

Because he is renting now, Henry hopes to build his own shop in 5 years time.  His major challenges include competitors, and home expenses. Henry says that, first of all, he has alot of appreciation for Finance Sudan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase items like powdered milk, Tang juice, sugar, rice and many others.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La socia sigue administrando y mejorando su negocio de restaurante, la socia poco a pococ podra hacer realidad su negocio ella pondra en sus mismo local un horno para sacar polllo a la braza, pero por ahora la socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor, ahora que los productos subieron ella desea invertir en la compra de arroz en  bolsas, aceite por bidones, fideos, sal en bolsas, entre otros productos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar sus tienda y para poder elaborar sus comidas caseras y extras, la socia seguira trabajando para concretar sus proyectos a corto plazo.
texts.en:
The member continues managing and improving her restaurant business.  Little by little she will be able to make her business a reality.  In her same place she will install an oven to make barbecued chicken, but for now she needs the loan to invest in buying products wholesale.  Now that the products went up she wants to invest in buying bags of rice, cans of oil, vermicelli, bags of salt, and other products.

The member is requesting the loan to buy household necessity items to set up her store and to be able to make her homemade and additional meals.

She will continue working to realize her short-term projects.

loans.use: to buy household necessities to set up her store and to make her homemade and additional meals.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada es D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, ellas son amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad, ellas tienen muchas ganas D. progreso, es por ello que trabajan en forma conjunta a parte del trabajo individual que hacen, para que D. esa forma puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son muy conocidas en su barrio por la forma en que trabajan.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Yolanda, ella se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. comestibles, como ser empanadas, sandwish, croquetas y demás. Nos comenta que tiene muchas ventas pues los alimentos que prepara son muy pedidos. Gracias a este trabajo ella pueD. ayudar en la casa con los gastos.
Ella piD. la ayuda D. kiva y la fundación para la compra D. carne, pollo, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos para elaborar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is from the city of  Encarnación. They are friends and neighbours from this city and are very keen to get ahead which is why they work together as well as working individually, so that they can help each other. They are very well-known in the neighbourhood for the way in which they work. One of the members is Señora Yolanda who sells all kinds of food such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquets and others. She tells us that she has a lot of sales as the food she makes is very sought after. With this work she can help with the household expenses. 

She is asking for Kiva's and the Fundacion's help to buy meat, chicken, seasonings, baked goods and other ingredients to make her food.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, seasonings, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. In order to return with more income to the family, he decided to open his own business, which consists in selling a wide range of sweets. He has a good number of customers passing by his shop and he is well known by his tasty goods. Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to purchase additional sweets and pastries to sell. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sweets and pastries to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. Despite his young age, George man was able to start his business two years ago working as a painter. His income is needed to help support his family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more tools and purchase painting products. In the future, George plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: To buy tools and purchase painting products

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. She’s a brave and talented young woman looking for a better future. She has been working as a beautician since 2009 providing customers with beauty services wherever they are located. Cynthia is friendly and knows very well how to gain and maintain her customers. Today, she’ asking to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies in order to satisfy her customer’s needs. In the future, Cynthia plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 54 year old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 25 and 10. 3 of them go to school. 

Mohamad runs a mixed food store business, and he has been in the business for 3 years. He has no employees. Mohamad heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase items like tomato paste, cooking oil, saltand other products. This is Mohamad's has only source of income. His major challenges include  competitors and the high cost of living in Juba.

In 5 years time, Mohamad would hopes to build his own shop. 

Mohamad says, "God bless the owners of Finance Sudan for this opportunity to happen in Sudan".

loans.use: to purchase items like tomato paste, cooking oil, salt and other products.

loans.name: Luz Clarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ CLARITA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María Isabel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido, venta de comida, tienda de estuco, venta de CD’s, tejido en macramé.

La señora María Isabel,  indica que hace dos años trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de estuco que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de estuco) que comprara de las personas que le traen de provincia  y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo la hija de una de las socias que se encuentra detras de la señora de manta verde
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luz Clarita" ("Clear Light") will take out their fourth loan cycle through Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional office.  The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a board led by Maria Isabel.  The businesses undertaken by the members of the communal bank are varied; they include weaving, sales of food, a stucco store, sales of CDs, and macrame.  

Maria Isabel says that she began working in Pro Mujer two years ago and that she became involved with the organization at the invitation of promoters.  She has a business that sells stucco, which she has been doing for years, learning the trade from her husband.

This loan is to increase her working capital (to purchase stucco), which she will buy from people who bring it from the province.  Afterward, she will sell it in her sales space.  This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has five children.     

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria Isabel responds that she likes the subject of health.  

In the photograph, the daughter of one of the partners appears behind the woman in the green shawl.

loans.use: To buy stucco.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals to breed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase lambs to re-sell

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Esperanza Del Socorro de 55 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de tiste y bolsas plásticas. Es una señora muy dedicada, ella le gusta este trabajo desde que la despidieron de su empleo.  Ella quiere este crédito para la compra de maíz, azúcar, cacao y bolsa entre otro. Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para la elaboración del tiste. Pero a la señora esperanza le gustaría ampliar más su negocio para seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro is 55 years old.  She sells tiste (a popular regional drink made of toasted corn and ground cocoa) and plastic bags.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She likes this work, as she was let go from her previous job.  

She wants this loan to buy corn, sugar, cocoa, and bags, among other things.  She wakes up very early in the morning to make tiste, but Esperanza would like to further expand her business to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, sugar, cocoa, and bags.

loans.name: Federman

texts.es: El señor Federman a sus 63 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como estuches para controles de televisión y equipos de sonido, pilas (baterías) para pequeños electrodomésticos y controles para televisión. Esta labor el señor Federman la realiza desde hace 15 años y con la cual a sacado adelante a su esposa y cinco hijos.  El señor Federman decidió realizar este trabajo porque le permite estar cerca a su familia y dedicarles más tiempo; el trabajo que realizaba anteriormente era de mayordomo en fincas muy alejado de su familia. El señor Federman desea comprar  mercancía para poder ampliar su surtido y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y capital de trabajo y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Federman is 63 years old and sells merchandise such as cases for both television remote controls and sound systems, batteries for small appliances, and television remote controls.  Federman has been doing this work for 15 years, and with this employment he has supported his wife and five children.  

Federman decided to start this job because it allowed him to be close to his family and spend more time with them.  Previously, he worked as a steward in farms located very far away from his family.  

Federman hopes to buy merchandise to expand his selection.  In doing so, he can increase his income and working capital, and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as batteries, television remote controls, sound systems, and cases.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 menores hijos, Jack, Luis y Beto; juntos buscan que salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo en la localidad de Carampa, que es donde viven. Cada día Silvia se despierta al amanecer y se dirige hacia sus campos de maíz, junto con su esposo para  vigilar sus  tierras, pues la cosecha futura debe ser  muy productiva, saben que con mucho esfuerzo lo lograrán. La agricultura, según dice es una actividad que le genera ganancias regulares que le permiten brindar a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida  le gusta sembrar las tierras ya que sabe cómo hacerlo, lo que no le gusta son las  constantes plagas que muchas veces arruinan gran parte de la cosecha, por eso es necesario la constante vigilancia. Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya que ante cualquier emergencia que se le presente puede vender alguno y ganar dinero .Como es una dama muy luchadora tiene muchos planes para progresar, entre ellos se encuentra el de comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para continuar en la comercialización. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “carampa” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.
Silvia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero en la compra fertilizantes para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three minor children; Jack, Luis, and Beto.  Together they look to get ahead through much effort and work in Carampa, which is where they live.

Silvia gets up at dawn and heads towards the corn fields with her husband in order to tend to their land.  The future harvest should be very productive.  They know that with much effort they will attain a good harvest.  

Farming, according to her, is a business activity that generates regular income.  This allows her to offer her family an adequate quality of life.  She likes to plant the fields because she knows how to do so.  What she does not like are the constant pest infestations that often ruin a big part of the harvest.  That is why constant vigilance is necessary.

At the same time she raises cattle because she can sell some and make money when faced with any emergency.  As a very tenacious woman, she has lots of plans to make progress.  Among these plans is to buy more cattle in order to continue selling them.

She belongs to the Carampa communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy because she receives support from all of you, which allows her to continue with her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Her association is comprised of responsible and supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will buy fertilizers to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es: Eucalda, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo, Arturo y sus 3 hijos; Gisela, Erika y Fanny a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Carampa. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió lo que era necesario para la correcta siembra y producción de las tierras; de esta manera cuando se unió a su esposo no dudo, junto con él, en  seguir trabajando la tierra y empezaron con la siembra de maíz. Tiempo después vieron que las ganancias de las ventas del maíz, les permitían sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de darles educación a sus hijas que era lo que más interesaba. Ha pasado el tiempo y continua  sembrando maíz, además paralelamente  también se dedica a la crianza de  ganado porcino, que engorda, para luego comercializar en las ferias de la zona por donde vive, y la actividad  le da buenas ganancias, que junto a las de la siembra le permite ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia .Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de esta legumbre está muy alto en el mercado. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “carampa” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Eucalda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Eucalda, 36, lives in her own house with her husband, Arturo, and their three children, Gisela, Erika and Fanny. She takes care of them in her own house, located in Carampa. 
At an early age Eucalda learned how to sow and reap correctly. That is why when she joined her husband, she had no doubt that they would keep on working with agriculture and they started planting maize. They realized that the income from maize allowed them to cater very well for their family and to provide their children with education, which was their priority.
Time has passed by and Eucalda still plants maize. She combines this with raising pigs. She raises them and then sells them at local fairs around her community, which enables her to offer her family a good quality of life.
Eucalda has a very entrepreneurial spirit and plans to grow green peas in the near future because she knows the market price for this produce is very high. She belongs to solidarity group “Carampa” and this is her fourth loan with the institution, where she feels happy because she receives support from all of you who allow her to stay in business. She also promises to repay on time because her group is made up of responsible and supportive people.
If Eucalda gets support, she will invest her money in the purchase of green pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizers for her next planting season.

loans.use: to purchase green pea seeds and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: El señor Jorge Iván desde los 10 años de edad aprendió de su padre la elaboración de herraduras y desde entonces se dedica a esta labor acompañado de sus dos hijos a quienes les enseñó esta labor.  El señor Jorge Iván compra metal para fabricar las herraduras en el taller que tiene en el patio de su casa y el producto terminado lo vende a un mayorista del municipio de Sonson ubicado en el occidente de Antioquia.  El señor Jorge desea comprar hierro y carbón para continuar con la elaboración de las herraduras y de esta manera lograr mayores ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
When Jorge Iván was ten years old he learned from his father how to make horseshoes.  From then on he has devoted himself to this work.  He taught his two children this work, and they work with him.

Jorge Iván buys metal in order to make the horseshoes in his workshop, which is on the patio of his house.  He sells the finished product to a wholesaler in the Sonson municipality to the west of Antioquia.

Jorge wishes to buy more iron and coal to continue making the horseshoes.  That way he will attain greater income and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material like iron and coal.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora D. 64 años vive en compañía D. su esposo y uno D. sus hijos, en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Saño.  Hace 6 años abrió su tienda D. comestibles en su propia casa a fin D. poder tener una vida más tranquila, ella y su esposo se jubilaron es por eso que  desean seguir trabajando  pero D.  manera independiente, es así que Doña Teodora  es la encargada principal D. la atención D. su establecimiento en las cuales los días; donD. recibe mayores ganancias es cuando son las fechas muy festivas en su localidad como las fiestas patronales, fiestas patrias, día D. los santos, etc. Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer es por ello que siempre esta al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa. Ella pertenece al grupo oslidario “Cantuta” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo D. todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Teodora D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en surtir su tienda D. comestibles para esta campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64, lives with her husband and one of her children in the town of San Pedro D. Saño.  Six years ago she opened her general store in her own house to be able to have a more peaceful life.  She and her husband retired, so they want to continue working, but independently.

In this way Teodora is the main one in charge of their business.  They receive the greatest profits on the most festive days in their town, such as patron saint days, national holidays, birthdays, etc.  Teodora does not miss any opportunity to grow, which is why she always devotes time to making innovations and improving her store, to keep it productive.

She belongs to the Cantuta solidarity group, and this is her sixth loan with MFP.  She feels happy about it since she is receiving the support of all of you, who allow her to continue with her business.  She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, since her bank is maD. up of responsible and supportive people.

When Teodora receives her support she will invest the money requested in supplying her store for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy sweets and various products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 21 años, es una mujer del campo. Vive en compañía de su mamá Graciela y sus 3 hermanos: José, Sayuri y Alex a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Armaspampa. Hace poco vendió los 2 toros que poseía. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como las 15 ovejas, 3 vacas y toros que posee; los que alimenta para luego engordarlos y venderlos al mejor postor. Le va muy bien en su negocio y le gusta ello, ya que así puede ayudar a sus hermanos y a Graciela, su mamá, que es una valiente madre soltera.  De la misma manera cuenta con sembríos de papa, cebada, alverja, habas y trigo, los que realiza en terrenos agrícolas propios, cuenta que posee 2 hectáreas que en cada cosecha producen los alimentos que comercializa en la feria de Acostambo. Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado ya que vendió muchos y ahora se quedo con pocos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatum Llacta” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Elva, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de papa “yungay”.
texts.en:
Elva, 21, is a country woman.  She lives with her mother Graciela and her three siblings, José, Sayuri, and Alex, whom she takes care of in her own home, located in the community of Armaspampa.

A short time ago she sold the two bulls that she had.  She works raising animals, such as her fifteen sheep, three cows, and bulls, which she feeds to fatten and later sell.  It is going very well for her in her business and she likes this, since in this way she can help her siblings and Graciela, her mother, who is a courageous single mother.  At the same time, she has potato, barley, pea, bean, and wheat crops, which she grows on her own croplands.  She says she has two hectares that in each harvest produce food that she sells in the market of Acostambo.

Now she wants to increase her livestock since she sold many animals and has only a few remaining.

She belongs to the Jatum Llacta solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  Also, she likes to be part of her bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

When Elva receives her support she will invest the requested money in buying natural fertilizer to spread on her crop of Yungay potatoes.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Oumou Khairé

texts.fr: Madame Oumou Khairé  est mariée et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 12 ans. Elle est âgée  de 32 ans et s’active dans  le commerce et la vente de tissus, portables, prêt à porter, etc. Elle a une expérience  de 2 ans dans son activité. C’est un choix qu’elle a fait pour pouvoir  travailler pour son propre compte et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Elle est membre  de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2011 et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus  teintés  qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif avec ce financement est de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire, de gagner une part  plus importante du marché et élargir son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs Oumou Khairé is a 32 year old married woman living in Senegal, and a mother of three children aged 5 to 12. She has been involved in the sale of cloth, mobile phones, ready to wear clothing, etc for the past two years. She made this choice in order to work on her own conditions and to satisfy her personal needs. She has been a member of the UIMCEC bank since September 2011 and is asking for a loan of 400,000 francs [approximately 820 USD] to purchase dyed cloth to be re-sold. Her goal with this financing is to receive more revenues, gain market share and increase her retail activity.

loans.use: purchase cloth to re-sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 32 años es un hombre feliz. Pues vive en compañía de su esposa Ronaldina, desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores a lo que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Vista Alegre. Sus constates viajes a las diferentes ferias del país, hacen que obtenga buenas ganancias. Todo ello gracias a la comercialización de animales como: ovejas, vacas, toros, burros y caballos. Según cuenta gana un promedio de 100 nuevos soles por cada ejemplar. Su trabajo es esforzado, pues tiene que viajar mucho. Después de cada viaje, dispone un mes para descansar; en ese tiempo aprovecha para cuidar de sus cultivos de papa y cebada los que en cada cosecha comercializa a la feria de Acostambo, que se realiza todos los viernes de cada semana. Cuenta que su economía es estable, todo gracias a su esposa quien administra las ganancias y cuida de los cultivos cuando él está ausente. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatum Llacta” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Edgar, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Edgar, 32, is a happy man since he has lived with his wife Ronaldina for 12 years.  Together they have four children, all of them minors whom they care for in their own home, located in the community of Vista Alegre.

His constant trips to different markets in the country allow for him to make good profits, all thanks to selling animals such as sheep, cows, bulls, burros, and horses.  As he tells it, he earns an average of 100 PEN for each animal.

His work is demanding, since he has to travel a lot.  After each trip his takes a month to rest.  He takes advantage of that time to take care of his potato and barley crops, which at each harvest he sells in the market in Acostambo, which is every Friday.  He says his finances are stable, all thanks to his wife who manages the profits and takes care of the crops when he is away. 

He belongs to the Jatum Llacta solidarity group, and this is his first loan with MFP.  He hopes for your collaboration so he can realize his plans.  On the other hand, he promises to make his payments.  In addition, he enjoys being part of his bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

When Edgar receives his support he will invest the requested money in buying several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows and bulls.

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es: La señora Luz Mariela a sus 45 años de edad, se dedica a la producción y venta de arepas desde su casa; las arepas son un alimento tradicional de Antioquia y es elaborada con maíz. Esta idea inicio de su esposo quien la ánimo para que se dedicara a esta labor y de esta forma dejar su anterior trabajo que no le permitía estar mucho tiempo con sus 6 hijos. Actualmente la señora Luz Mariela desea comprar un nuevo fogón para la fabricación de las arepas y adquirir materia prima como el maíz, lo anterior le permitiría a ella producir en mayor cantidad y menor tiempo las arepas y así tener mayores ingresos. La señora Luz Mariela sueña con tener su propia fábrica de arepas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Mariela is 45 years old, and she makes and sells arepas from her home.  Arepas are made with corn and are a traditional dish from Antioquia (the Department in which Fredonia is located).  

Her husband gave her the idea for this business and encouraged her to do this work.  In doing so, she could leave her previous job, which did not leave her much time with her six children.  

Luz Mariela wants to buy a new stove to make the arepas and purchase raw materials, such as corn.  This will allow her to produce more arepas in less time, thus increasing her income.  Luz Mariela dreams of having her own arepas factory and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove and raw materials such as corn.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 20 años es una joven madre soltera. Vive en el caserío de Acolla, junto a su madre e hijo Damian. Gracias al terreno que le heredó su mamá ella puede sembrar papa, maíz y alverja, esto le permite adquirir algunos ingresos para su hijo y ella. Cuenta que en épocas de cosecha trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, así puede juntar dinero para su próxima siembra. Aun cuenta con pequeños sembríos pero eso no la desanima, ya que tiene las ganas de seguir triunfando sobre todo porque es una mujer que no se rinde con facilidad. Ahora desea abrir peluquería, ya dio el primer paso con la adquisición de un pequeño local, donde comenzará a realizar cortes, peinados y maquillajes, puso sillas y espejos. Le falta muy poco y está segura de concretar su objetivo.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias. Pilar de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de utensilios para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Pilar is 20 years old and a single mother.  She lives in the Acolla neighborhood, together with her mother and her son, Damian.  Thanks to the land that her mother inherited, she can plant potatoes, corn, and peas; this provides some income for herself and her son.  During periods of harvest, she also works as a laborer in other farms so she can raise money her next planting.  Her few crops do not discourage her.  She desires to triumph over everything because she is a woman who does not give up easily.

Now, she would like to open a beauty salon.  Pilar already took the first step by acquiring a small premises where she will begin to cut and style hair, as well as do makeup for her patrons.  She has set up seats and mirrors; she only needs a few remaining things and is sure of realizing her goal.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadores" ("Fighting Women").  This is her first loan with MFP, where she hopes for all of your support to achieve her goal.  She promises to make her loan payments punctually, as her communal bank is composed of responsible individuals who support each other.  Upon receiving your support, Pilar will invest the loan to purchase items for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo y tiene una hija de 27 años.  Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como sabanas, ropa en general, calzado, bolsos entre otros productos que le encargan sus clientes, porque vende a crédito en plazos adaptados a las necesidades de estos. En sus inicios como emprendedora, se dedicaba a la venta de prendas de plata y así fue como logró una primera clientela doméstica que poco a poco fue creciendo, con el oportuno servicio que le ofrecía Rosmery y gradualmente le permitió agregar todos los productos como hasta hoy lo hace. Con su negocio ha logrado  pagar la educación de su hija, a quien ha sacado adelante con su propio esfuerzo, pues es profesional de la contaduría pública y ahora ella la apoya con los gastos comunes del hogar. El sueño de Rosmery es ampliar su negocio y algún día comprar su propio vehículo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado, bolsos, prendas de vestir, pues se acerca la temporada de mayor  rentabilidad para su negocio, porque se incrementan tradicionalmente los pedidos que hacen sus clientes y esto es justamente en lo cual basa su inversión y planea que sea exitosa pues con dinero efectivo, logrará  compras en mayor cantidad y con mejores descuentos, lo cual trasladará a sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 46 years old, lives in the municipality of Malambo, and has a 27-year old daughter.  There, she works selling various merchandise, such as sheets, clothes, footwear, and bags, which she provides to her clients on credit with installment periods tailored to their needs.  When she began as an entrepreneur, she sold silver items, and through that, she found her first domestic customers.  These customers began to grow, little by little, with the useful service that Rosmery offered them.  Gradually she was able to accumulate all the products like the ones she sells today.

With her business, she has paid for the education of her daughter, who has succeeded by her own efforts.  Her daughter is now a professional accountant and helps Rosmery with some of the household expenses.  Rosmery's dream is to expand her business and, one day, to buy her own car.  

She is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy footwear, bags, articles of clothing.  The most profitable period for her business is approaching, because her customers usually begin asking for more things.  This is the reason for her desired investment.  She plans to succeed because with cash, she will be able to buy more with better discounts, which will translate into profits for her.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and items of clothing.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Monsieur Issa est un jeune commerçant  de 30 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et évolue depuis 1998 dans la commercialisation de denrées alimentaires, oignons, pomme de terre, ails et autres produits divers.  Il a choisi son activité par passion et aussi dans le but de rechercher  la  possibilité de se prendre en charge, Car trouver un emploi dans le secteur formel devient un véritable calvaire. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est son aspect lucratif et les relations qu’il tisse avec les clients. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite depuis un an. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires en vue de renouveler et ou   renforcer son stock et pouvoir répondre a la demande croissante  de la clientèle. Son intention est de ‘élargir son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mr Issa is a young 30 year old business man living in Senegal. He is single and has been working in the retail sector since 1998, selling food products such as onions, potatoes, garlic and other products. Her is passionate about his business and also enjoys being self-employed. He is most interested by the viability of his business as well as the relationships he is able to cultivate with this clients. He has been a member of the UIMCEC bank where he lives for the past year. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs [approximately X USD] in order to purchase food products in larger quantities and be able to address the demands of his clients. He would like to increase the activity of his business.

loans.use: purchase food products to re-sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Esther; La socia tiene 58 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica actualmente al negocio de venta de tamales y tambien se dedica a la venta de artesania,ella hace collares,pulseras y aretes y lo vende al por mayor,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tamales y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como maiz,manteca y azucar para preparar los tamales y tambien comprar hilos y alambres para hacer los aretes,collares y pulseras.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Esther is 58 years old, single, and has a son. Her present business is selling tamales and also, artisan crafts: she makes bracelets, and earrings and sell them at wholesale. By means of these businesses, she advances her son. Esther wishes to expand and improve both businesses, the sales of tamales and artisan crafts. She requests a loan to buy supplies such as corn, lard, and sugar to prepare tamales and also, to buy thread and wire to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets.

Esther is grateful and values the loan offered through this medium and, at the same time, promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, lard and sugar to prepare tamales, and also to buy thread and wire to make earrings, necklaces, and bracelets to sell.

loans.name: Benancia

texts.es: La señora Benancia nacio en la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive en la comunidad de Chaqui Cocha km 76 sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz. La vivienda que habita la clienta es rustico de las características de adobe y techo de paja prácticamente rustico. La actividad a que se dedica es la agricultura que produce los tubérculos y cereales en su comunidad, los trabajos agrícolas realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos en ayne y mink'a. El presente crédito está solicitando para la compra de insumos agrícolas de esa manera mejorar el incremento de su actividad económica y la calidad de vida en la familia.
texts.en:
Benancia was born in Tiraque province, Department of Cochabamba. She currently lives in the Chaqui Cocha community, on the 76th km of the old Santa Cruz road. She lives in a rustic house with adobe walls and straw roofs.
Benancia makes a living of agriculture and produces cereals and root vegetables for her community. She plants with the help of her family and, occasionally, her neighbors in collaborative schemes such as ayne and mink’a. Benancia is asking for this loan to purchase agricultural supplies that could help her increase her economic activity and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora María Alejandra a sus 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de helado, snakcs y dulces; debido al invierno presentado en la región, ella desea diversificar su negocio y vender adicionalmente comidas rápidas. Este trabajo lo inicio con el fin de generar mayores ingresos y estar más tiempo con su hija de 8 años. La señora María Alejandra cuenta con el apoyo de su abuela y una tía, puesto que el padre de su hija no vive con ella.
Actualmente, La señora María Alejandra desea comprar un carro para comidas rápidas y surtido como panes, carnes, salsas y platos desechables.  Con esta nueva variedad de producto en su negocio, la señora María Alejandra podrá incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hija. A futuro la señora María Alejandra desea tener su propia casa y sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra, age 27, makes a living out of selling ice cream, snacks and candies. Because of the cold, rainy season that affects her region, she wishes to diversify her business by adding fast food. She started this business in order to generate a greater income and spend more time with her 8-year-old daughter. 
Maria Alejandra receives support from her grandmother and aunt because the father of her child does not live with them.
At present, she wants to purchase a fast food cart and related items such as bread, meats, sauces and disposable plates. By adding this product to her business, she will be able to increase her income and thus to improve the quality of life of herself and her daughter. In the future, Maria Alejandra would like to own a house and help her young daughter get through in life.

loans.use: to purchase a fast food cart and items such as bread, meats and sauces

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 30 años, es un hombre ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Maribel, su esposa desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Yerali, a la que quieren con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada en el caserío de Acolla. Para el bienestar de su familia, comenzó a trabajar en la ciudad de Huancavelica, donde es docente de educación secundaria, ahí obtiene un salario mensual de parte del estado peruano. Cada 15 días visita su casa, para cuidar de su esposa e hija, también para ver sus cultivos de papa y habas que siembra en terrenos alquilados y propios pero en menor cantidad. Además cuenta con animales como vacas de raza y varias ovejas; que enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio en la feria de la ciudad de Jauja que se realiza una vez por semana. Ahora planean ahorrar más dinero, pues quieren comprarse una casa propia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadora” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias.
Pedro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales, entre ellos ovejas de raza “Junín”, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 30, is a desirable model of a man. He lives with his wife Maribel, to whom he has been married for 4 years. They have a daughter called Yerali. They both love her deeply and care for her in a rented house in Acolla village. With his family welfare in mind, he took a job in Huancavelica City as a high school teacher. He receives a monthly wage from the Peruvian public sector. 
Every two weeks Pedro visits his house to take care of his wife and daughter, as well of his potato and fava bean plantations, which he has at rented plots, and also in some smaller plots of his own. Moreover, he has some animals such as cows and sheep, which he raises and then sales at a higher price at the Jauja city’s fair, organized once a week. He and his wife now plan to save more money because they want to buy a house.
