El  sueño del señor Basilio es tener un taller mas sofisticado y con una buena tecnología para que de este modo pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, y dar un servicio de primera, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
Basilio vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Basilio is a married man of 69 years of age. He is a car mechanic and he chose this kind of work as when very young he learned how to panel beat cars and repaint them and developed a vocation for the work. 

Basilio is a determined, hardworking and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead. Basilio has been doing this work since 1996. He earns about S/. 390 nuevos soles (PEN) as week. With the loan of S/. 2000 soles (PEN) which he will receive thanks to Kiva, Basilio will invest this loan in buying raw materials (carbudes, plates, paint, etc). Señor Basilio's dream is to have a more sofisticated workshop with good technology so that he can better attend his customers and give a first class service. His counselor thinks he is an excellent member and will make his repayments punctually.

Basilio lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the member's home and business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (carbides, plates, etc.)

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra Patricia a sus 36 años de edad y madre de un hijo de 10 años, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace nueve años. Ella trabaja intensamente con el fin de conseguir sus propios ingresos para la manutención de ella y de su pequeño hijo. La señora Sandra Patricia desea tener una nueva máquina fileteadora con la cual no tenga que subcontratar este servicio. A futuro la señora Sandra Patricia desea tener su taller de confección con punto de venta propio y una línea de propia de ropa femenina, con lo anterior podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo y generar empleos directos.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia is 36 years old, and she has a ten year old son.  She has been making clothes for nine years.  She works intensely in order to get her own income to support herself and her small son.

Sandra Patricia wishes to have a new overlock machine.  That way she does not have to subcontract for this service.

In the future Sandra Patricia wishes to have a sewing shop with her own place to sell.  She also wishes to have her own line of women’s clothing.  That way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her son.  She will also be able to generate actual employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to make clothing.

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: El señor Juan Fernando es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos, el trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular, con este ingreso y a base de mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia. Pero le esta preocupando la seguridad ya que su casa no cuenta con las protecciones en las ventanas y solicita este préstamo para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar y colocar las protecciones y así su familia va estar mas segura cuando estén en casa.
texts.en:
Juan is a family man and has two children. He works as a gardener at a private house, with this income and a thanks to a lot of effort, he has helped his family to succeed. 

But he is worried about safety as his house has no security devices on the windows and he is asking for this loan so he can pay someone to install the necessary protection. His family will then be safer when they are at a home.

loans.use: to buy security devices for the windows and doors of his home.

loans.name: Sugei

texts.es: Sugei de 36 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años. Ella desde hace 8 años arrendó una habitación a  un Bogotano, quien emprendiera una empresa de transporte y  le propusiera trabajar con él en este negocio, pues conocía que Sugei se encontraba estudiando mercadeo. Aunque le fue muy bien decidió abandonar esta actividad  porque su hijo nació con problemas, pero el propietario del negocio, satisfecho con su trabajo,  decidió emprender una sucursal en casa de Sugei, así fué como sugei compró sus equipos, enseres de oficina y se dedicó a venderle el servicio de administración de su empresa de transportes, como hasta la presente y en el cual le ha ido muy bien, pues ha logrado alternarlo con otro de venta de productos, mediante guías especializadas, con el que obtiene buenas ganancias, porque aprovecha el mercado de cada actividad. Su sueño más adelante es adquirir su propio camión de transporte y hacer su casa de dos pisos, para ampliar el negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará un nuevo computador y variedades de productos que vinieron en sus catálogos con descuentos especiales, con ello logará resultados exitosos porque aprovechará la temporada de Diciembre época en la cual hay buen movimiento de dinero.
texts.en:
Sugei is a 36 year old married woman who lives in the south of the city with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 15. 

For 8 years she has been leasing a room to a man from Bogota, who set up a transport business and suggested she work with him, since he knew that Sugei had been studying marketing. Although it went very well, she decided to give up the work because her son was born with special needs. However, the business owner, pleased with her work, decided to set up a branch in Sugei's home. 

This is how Sugei bought her office equipment and started to work providing management services for his transport business, which she still does and has done well in. She now alternates it with selling products, through catalogues, on which she makes a good profit because she makes the most of the market. 

Her dream for the future is to buy her own transport lorry and make her house into two flats so she can expand her business. 

At the moment, she is applying for her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy a new computer and various catalogue products, at special discounted prices. She will achieve excellent results from these as she will make the most of the December season when there is a lot of money changing hands.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and various catalogue products.

loans.name: Ilci Leojana

texts.es:
ILCI:
A sus 26 años, es madre de  2 niños, y  una mujer trabajadora, en su domicilio cuenta con un local donde vende ropa americana, cosméticos perfumería etc. También los fines de semana se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales, lo cual la hecho conocida y visitada por sus vecinos  en su negocio, ella requiere de capital para la compra de ropa de se segunda como suéteres, chumpas, chamarras, ya que debido a las grandes lluvias la gente ve la necesidad de abrigarse, sabe que la atención y la manera con que atiende a las personas que la visitan han sido parte de su crecimiento como pequeña negociante, como esposa colabora con sus ingresos al sustento de sus hijos y apoya a su esposo con proyectos que  tienen como pareja.
texts.en: Ilci, at her 26 years of age, is a mother of 2 children and a hardworking woman. In part of her house, she has an area where she sells used clothes, cosmetics and perfume, etc. At the weekends she also makes and sells tamales, which have made her popular and well frequented by her neighbours. She needs capital for her business to buy used clothes such as sweaters, jackets and windbreakers as due to the heavy rains people see the need to wrap up. She knows that the attention she pays people and the way she serves those who visit her have been part of her growth as a small busineswoman. As a wife she shares her income to support her children and supports her husband with projects they share as a couple.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caacupé trabajan conjuntamente para obtener mayores ingresos y D. esa forma ayudar a sus familias. Luchan diariamente, pues desean darle a sus familias lo mejor, para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo D. necesidades.
Una D. ellas es Sustiana, quien se dedica a la venta D. pollos, comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, por lo que ya se ha formado una buena clientela. Gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y cubrir sus gastos básicos. Ella al igual que sus amigas, integrantes D. comité, desean ayudar a sus familias dándoles una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. pollos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos D. su clientela. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
11 women from the city of Caacupé work together to earn a better income to help their families. They fight every day, as they want to give their families the best so that they don't want for anything.

One of them is Sustiana, who sells chickens for a living. She says that her business is going very well as she already has a good customer base. 

Thanks to her work and sacrifice, she has been able to support her family and cover their basic expenses. She and her friends, the members of the communal bank, want to help their families and give them a decent life.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy chickens to fulfil her customer's orders. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell on.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 35 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Yesenia necesita un equipo de computo, ya que es  madre soltera  y se le dificulta sacar adelante a sus hijos, sin esta herramienta tecnológica. 

Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), esto para la compra de un equipo de computo y asi facilitarles a sus hijos el hacer los trabajos y tareas, para que continúen con sus estudios y puedan llegar a ser grandes profesionales.

Yesenia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 35 years old and lives with her family in a community called San Carlos, in the second province of Costa Rica, Alajuela. The area holds first place nationally in coffee and sugar cane production. In addition the area produces staple food crops (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, root vegetables and other garden produce. Additionally the Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, the country's most important airport, is located in this province. 

Yesenia has needed a computer for several months since she is a single mother and it is difficult to get her children ahead without this technological tool. Thus she is seeking a loan in the amount of ¢400,000.00 (400 thousand colones) for the purchase of a computer in order to make it easier for her children to do their school work, in hopes that they may continue their studies and one day become great professionals. 

Yesenia is a member of the communal bank "El Encanto de Pital" and this is her first loan, in one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment for her children's education.

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Leobardo es padre de familia y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para elaborar la barda alrededor de su casa, necesita compara block, cemento, varilla y arena, ya que su papa de dedica a la construcción y le ayudara a realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y mejorarle una mejor protección.
texts.en:
Leobardo is a father and he worries for his family's safety.

He is requesting a loan to build a wall around his house. He needs to buy cement block, cement, rebar, and sand. His father works in construction and will help him with this improvement.

He wants to improve the quality of life for his family and to improve their protection.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Isabel, de 47 años de edad, originaria de La Concordia municipio de Jinotega, pero vive en el Coyolito comunidad localizada en las afueras de Estelí, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes y solo se hace cargo de su hija menor de 15 años de edad que esta estudiando la secundaria. Además de ser ama de casa, se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de hortalizas, lleva 10 años con esta actividad pero su experiencia en la siembra la  adquirió cuando tenían 20 años de edad sembrando cebolla. Actualmente vende su cultivo en la ciudad de Managua. Solicita el préstamo para  sembrar 1 manzana de repollo y una manzana de cebolla, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con el crédito le ayudara a sacar una producción de buena calidad. Ya que una de sus metas es vender el producto cancelar el crédito e invertir en comprar 2 vacas paridas para vender leche y preparar a su hija para que logre terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel, 47, is a native of the town of La Concordia in Jinotega, but she lives in El Coyolito, located on the outskirts of Estelí.  She has three children, two of whom are independent, so she is only in charge of her youngest daughter, age 15, who is studying in high school.

In addition to being a housewife, she works growing and selling vegetables.  She has been doing this job for 10 years, but she acquired her experience in planting when she was 20 years old growing onions.  Currently she sells her crop in the city of Managua.

She is requesting the loan to plant one "manzana" [7000 square meters] of cabbage and one of onion, to buy supplies and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.  The loan will help her get a good-quality crop, since one of her goals is to sell the product, pay back the loan, and invest in buying two calved cows to sell milk and prepare her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to plant cabbage and onion, to buy supplies and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es: Claritza es integrante D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” grupo conformado por 10 socios dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales. Claritza tiene 38 años D. edad  es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos dependientes  en etapa escolar. Motivada por una amiga y con los deseos D. mejorar L.  calidad D. vida D. su familia Claritza empezó un negocio D. L.  venta D. productos D. belleza L. cual lleva 02 años en dicho rubro, también nos manifiesta que trabaja en una panadería embolsando panes D. donD. obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. Estas actividades le ha ayudado mucho a Claritza gracias a ello ha logrado unos D. sus sueños comprar su propio terreno, donD. en L. actualidad vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Matucana- Huarochirí. Claritza tiene como meta instalar una tienda donD. pueda brindar productos D. primera necesidad, con los préstamos D. Edaprospo y con mucho esfuerzo  lo va a cumplir. En esta oportunidad solicito el préstamo para comprar productos D. belleza como cremas, talcos, colonias, y también para mejorar su vivienda por  fiestas NaviD.ñas. L. Alcancía Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Claritza is a member of the “Corazón D. Jesús” communal bank, which is composed of 10 members who work in different commercial activities. Claritza is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 dependent school-aged children. Encouraged by a friend and the desire to improve her family’s quality of life, Claritza began a business selling beauty products. She has been doing this for 2 years. She also tells us that she works in a bakery where she bags bread and she has this as another income for her household. These activities have helped Claritza a lot. Thanks to them she has achieved some of her dreams, like buying her own land, where she now lives with her family in the district of Matucana-Huarochirí. Claritza has as a goal to open a store where she will proviD. basic products. With the loans from Edaprospo and with a lot of work, she will achieve it. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as creams, powders, colognes, and also to improve her house for the Christmas festivities. The “Corazón D. Jesús” communal bank appreciates the loan provided.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as creams, powders, and colognes

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba de 52 años de edad es una mujer casada, que tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 23 a 31 años y viven en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene su negocio de vender mercancía variada a crédito  y por   encargos; negocio que inició hace 3 años, solamente  con la venta de cosméticos, entre sus amigas, familiares y vecinos, construyendo su primera clientela y poco a poco, fue creciendo a través de los referidos y de agregar cada una de las mercancías que los  intereses  y necesidades que su clientela señalaba. En la actualidad vende electrodomésticos, calzado, accesorios y mercancías varadas y está solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea comprar un surtido de mercancías sobre pedidos, que han hecho sus clientes, porque aprovechará la gran demanda de fin de año y entre sus metas está el crecimiento de su negocio para continuar fortaleciendo el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, is a married woman who has four children from 23 to 31 years of age. They live in the municipality of Soledad where she has her business selling a variety of merchandise on credit and by special order. She began her business three years ago selling only cosmetics among her friends, family members and neighbors, building her first customer base. Little by little she grew by referrals and by adding each of the kinds of merchandise indicated by the interests and needs of her customers. Currently she sells electrical appliances, footwear, accessories and other various merchandise. 

She is seeking her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she plans to buy an assortment of merchandise beyond the orders her customers have placed, in order to take advantage of the big year-end demand. Among her goals is the growth of her business, in order to continue to strengthen the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise beyond the orders her customers have placed.

loans.name: Enciende Una Luz 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is a single mother with 4 children who lives in the beautiful town of Samana. This area is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. Ramona says her most important challenge is to raise her children and guide them in a good way. She enjoys the kitchen and cooking.

Ramona is receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan.  She started her food business 8 months ago with the first loan she took from us. She will use this loan to purchase seafood, meat, chicken and vegetables. With her business profits (for the long term) she will save because she needs to repair her house and make her business prosperous. 

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy seafood, meat, chicken and vegetables for her food business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
MARCELINA:
Doña Marcelina, es una mujer con el deseo de superarse y sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos aunque solo tenga 2 pequeñitos, desde hace 9 años que su esposo falleció su vida cambio rotundamente, ya que tuvo que velar por sus hijos que gracias a Dios al día de hoy son quienes le brindan un ingreso para sus hermanos pequeños, fue de esta manera  en la que ella vio la necesidad de buscar la manera de ganarse un ingreso para sus hijos, empezó con la venta de ropa típica con algunas conocidas quienes la apoyaron, ahora ya logra tener un poco en  sus ventas, también se dedica a ayudar en oficios domésticos a sus vecinas, siempre al tanto de su pequeño negocio, por lo que requiere de capital para invertir un poco mas en la compra de ropa tipica para la venta ya  que le solicitan sus clientes y ella nos tiene ella quiere ver crecer a sus hijos y brindarles todo lo posible para que ellos estudien y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
MARCELINA:

Marcelina is a woman who very much wants to improve herself and raise her six children even though just two of them are still little.  Nine years ago her husband died and her life changed radically because she had to see after her children.  Thanks to God it’s now they who provide her with income for their little siblings.  It was in this way that she saw the need to find a way to earn income for her children.  She started selling traditional clothing to some acquaintances that helped her out.  She is able now to earn a little from her sales.  She also does domestic chores for her neighbors always watching over her small business though.  This is why she needs capital to invest a bit more in traditional clothing to sell because her customers request items that she does not have.  She wants to see her children grow up and provide them with everything possible so that they can go to school and prepare themselves for life.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El cliente trabaja hace muchos años como agricultor, como es propietario en el recae la responsabilidad donde se encuentra ubicado en el Sindicato Illimani donde tiene la produccion de platano, citricos y yuca para la produccion y sustento de su familia. Entonces el cliente recurre a  para obtener un prestamo el cual invertira en la plantacion de papaya, el cliente es humilde, de sociedad media y persona del lugar con ganas de trabajar y empeñoso. El credito le ayudara  mucho en el progreso de su familia y desarrollar mas la produccion y su forma de vida ya que tiene que mantener 4 hijos.
texts.en: The client has worked as a farmer for many years.  Since he’s an owner the responsibility falls on him.  He’s located in Sindicato Illimani where he grows banana, citrus fruits, and cassava both to sell and for his family’s sustenance.  He has come by to request a loan that he’ll use to pay for his papaya plantation.  This loan will help him very much because he’s from a humble, middle class family and a person from the location who very much wants to work and is very dedicated since he has to support 4 children.

loans.use: to pay for his papaya plantation

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria es divorciada y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, de dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos y trabaja de limpieza en una oficina. Necesita aumentar sus ventas es por eso que solicita un préstamo para compra de mercancía y aprovechar  las ofertas de navideñas. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y proporcionarles un mejor futuro. Y con esta inversión su negocio tendrá más ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa María is divorced; she has two children in her care.  She sells beauty products via catalogue sales and also works cleaning an office.  She needs to increase sales and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise and take advantage of Christmas specials.  She wants to improve her family’s quality of life and provide a better future for them.  With this investment, her business will have more profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and items on special Christmas mark-downs.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana cuenta desde hace 10 meses con un local donde vende productos químicos, naturales y veterinarios. Los productos que ofrece tienen muy buena acogida en el barrio donde habita y en sus aledaños;  la ubicación de su negocio es una gran fortaleza pues se encuentra ubicada en la vía principal, por donde transitan normalmente un gran número de personas de esta zona. Su negocio debe permanecer siempre surtido con muchas líneas de productos, porque maneja una rotación que así lo exiAl analizar el estado de resultados del negocio de Eliana, se puede observar un buen nivel de ventas, que le permiten cubrir los costos operacionales, gastos familiares y reinvertir en el negocio; su balance muestra un rubro de gran tamaño, que es el de inventario, debido a la diversidad de productos que ofrece, por eso para ella es una gran ventaja  mantener un Stop aceptable en cada uno de ellos.   En su sueño de crecimiento Eliana, necesita invertir en mayores cantidades los productos que más rotan y que ofrecen descuentos especiales que le permitan ganar un poco más. Esta es la razón de estar aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará de contado y de oportunidad, propolio zarzaparrilla miel de abeja, escoba, purgante, aceite relajante jabón,  ceras y escancias; con su credikiva planea hacerlo para financiar su cartera de crédito, porque dispone de muy poco efectivo disponible para hacer compras. Su éxito radica en fomentar mayores utilidades con un crédito a bajo costo y lograr una respuesta siempre oportuna a sus clientes a los que cuida para poder surgir como ella lo pretende.
texts.en:
Eliana opened a store ten months ago where she sells natural and chemical veterinary products.  The products she sells are widely sought-after in the neighborhood where she lives and in surrounding areas.  Her store’s location is very strong since it’s on the main road where many local residents normally pass by.  Her store must always be well stocked with many product lines because she manages a stock turn over that demands it.  

Upon analyzing the state of Eliana’s  business results, one can observe a good sales level that allows her to meet occupational costs, family expenses and to reinvest in the business.  Her balance shows a line of work that’s large, which is the inventory, due to the large variety of products she offers.  For her, then, it’s most advantageous to keep in stock acceptable levels of each.  In Eliana’s dream of growth, she needs to invest in larger amounts of the items that sell the most and which are on special markdown that will allow her to earn a bit more profit.  

This is the reason behind her first loan application with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to pay cash and special rates for Propoleo [syrup made from honey], sarsaparilla, honey, ‘escoba’ [medicinal plant], emetics, relaxation oil, soap, wax and essences.  She plans to use her Kiva loan to finance her credit portfolio since she has very little cash available to make her purchases.  Her success resides in pushing higher profits with a low-cost loan to attain opportune response from customers who she cares for so that she can attain the growth she aims for.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
La formación D. este comité fue gracias a una D. las miembros quien oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación y comento a sus amigas y vecinas, quienes gustosas aceptaron formar parte D. este programa. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en ciclo doce, con 12 integrantes, todas ellas participan muy activamente en las actividades.
Una D. ellas es la señora Mirtha, quien se dedica a la venta D. quesos. Comenta que sus productos tienen mucha salida por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con el,ya que gracias a eso tiene muy buenos ingresos. Dice que todo el trabajo que ella hace es por darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. quesos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members who heard talk about the Fundación enterprising women program and commented to her friends and neighbors who happily agreed to be part of this program.  They are currently in their 12th cycle with 12 members; they all participate very actively in the activities.

One of them is Mirtha who sells cheese.  She comments that her products sell well so she’d like to continue in business because thanks to it she earns good income.  She says that all the work she does is to give her family everything they need.

She asks for the loan to buy cheeses to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cheeses for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Mejor Futuro 4 Group

texts.en:
Yohanni is a young woman with a child. She lives in a zone of little resources in the city of Santiago, which is one of the most populated in the Dominican Republic. Yohanni says her most favorites things to do are reading and watching television. She operates a nail salon where she serves her customers with manicures, pedicures, and placing artificial nails sevices.

Yohanni is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital to buy nail polish, acrylic nails, and others materials. She started her business 3 years ago with her own savings after she learned how to work with nails. With her business profits she will reinvest in her business. She  dreams of having a nail and beauty salon in a better location.

Yohanni and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores etc. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy nail polish and acrylic nails

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel es mecánico tiene 20 años dedicándose a este oficio, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Donde su vivienda  es pequeña por lo que empezó a construir mas cuartos en la planta alta, pero le esta haciendo falta la losa de concreto ya que necesitan sus hijos su propio espacio en la casa. 
Desea tener un mejor patrimonio, seguridad y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a mechanic who has 20 years of experience in that profession; he is married and has two children.  His house is small, and therefore he started constructing more rooms on the top floor.  However, he lacks concrete slabs for construction, and his children need their own space in the house.
Juan Manuel wants his family to have more wealth, security, and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase concrete slabs for construction.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny, de 33 años es una mujer amable. Hace 12 años que formó su familia; donde tuvo 4 hijos pero solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Ella es una mujer luchadora trabaja con ahínco para salir adelante. Hace 3 años su economía se estableció, pues comenzó a trabajar en una empresa exportadora de alcachofas, donde tiene un salario mensual, muy bueno y estable. Además por las tardes cría ovejas, las que enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Durante 2 días al mes, se esmera para tener su hogar limpio, pues su esposo regresa de trabajar en la mina durante varios días, para dejar dinero y pasar un tiempo con sus hijos. Eso le gusta mucho a él. Ahora desean juntar dinero para solventar los estudios de sus hijos, quienes están creciendo y ya deben postular a la universidad. Para ello, quiere aprovechar la temporada de navidad y vender productos de la época. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe en su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias.
Yeny de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de diversos y surtidos adornos para navidad, pues quiere aprovechar la temporada que se avecina.
texts.en:
Yeny is 33, and a friendly woman. She started her family 12 years ago, and has four children; but only three of them live with her in the house she owns, which is located in the village of Ataura.

She is a determined woman who works hard to get ahead. Her finances stabilized three years ago, as she started working at a company that exports artichokes. There she has a very good, steady, monthly salary. 

Also, in the afternoons, she raises sheep, which she fattens and then sells at a better price.  For two days a month, she does her best to have a clean home, as her husband returns for several days from working in the mines. He does this to leave money and spend time with his children. He really likes that. Now they wish to save money to pay for their children's education, as they are growing up, and already must apply for university.

That's why she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season and sell seasonal products.

She belongs to the "Palomitas" solidarity group, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support all of you have given her, as it makes it possible for her to continue with her business. In addition, she promises to make her payments on time, as she likes to work with responsible and supportive people.  

Once she receives her loan, Yeny will use the money she applied for to buy various and assorted Christmas decorations, as she wants to take advantage of the approaching season.

loans.use: To buy decorations with Christmas motifs for sale.

loans.name: Unidad De Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El comité "Unidas de Santa Clara" surgió a través de una promoción que se realizó en la zona. Las integrantes viven en el mismo barrio y se conocen hace tiempo, por lo que ya han hecho una buena amistad. Ellas tienen por objetivos fomentar el espiritu emprendedor, la solidaridad y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de la fundación.
Mirta es una de las miembros, nos comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de confites de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien. Dice que gracias a sus buenas manos con los dulces es que le va muy bien. Comenta que hace confites para todo tipo de eventos y gracias a eso se ha hecho muy conocida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, huevos, manteca y demás ingredientes para la elaboración de confites. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The "Unidas de Santa Clara" communal bank came about through an outreach campaign that was carried out in the area. The members live in the same neighborhood, and have known each other for some time, so they have already formed a good friendship. They have as their objectives: promoting an enterprising spirit, mutual support, and reaching the highest level of the Foundation's program.  

Mirta is one of the members. She says that she makes sweets of all kinds, and that it is going very well. She says that she makes the sweets for all kinds of events, and thanks to that she has become very well known. She is asking for the loan to buy flour, eggs, lard, and the rest of the ingredients for making sweets.

She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, lard, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Emperatriz María

texts.es: Emperatriz con su anterior credikiva compró ropa, calzado, y juguetes que vendió y obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, que tiene encargada para la temporada de fin de año, donde todos cambian su ajuar de ropas y sus clientes no serán la excepción, así mismo pintará su preescolar preparandose para el nuevo año escolar 2012. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente:" Gracias a ustedes he logrado salir adelante con mi negocio, porque son creditos con bajas tasas de financiación, por ello resultan muy atractivos, por eso espero me apoyen nuevamente."
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Emperatriz purchased clothing, footwear and toys which she then sold for a good profit.  Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy clothing and footwear for which she has orders for the end of the year season.  During this season everyone changes their wardrobe and her customers will be no exception.  

She will also paint her pre-school in preparation for the new 2012 school year.  Her message to her financial supporters is the following: "Thanks to you I have been able to get ahead with my business, because the loans have low interest rates and turn out to be very helpful.  So I hope that you will support me again."

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear and to paint her pre-school education center.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 22 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su único hijo “Rolando” a quien cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Ella es una valiente madre soltera, su vida centra en cuidar a su hijo. Para eso realiza varias actividades, durante la mañana prepara los ricos panes y rosquitas típicas de zona, pues tiene que abastecer los pedidos que tiene, además ella misma vende en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad de Jauja, una vez por semana. Asimismo todas las tardes vende comida a los trabajadores de la escuela que se está construyendo, ya por la noche vende hamburguesas y papas al hilo con cremas ricas. Todos estos trabajos le ayudan a ser una mujer independiente y sobre todo a mantener a su hijo, darle comida, vestido y estudio. Lo que ella más quiere es verlo crecer y salir adelante con una carrera universitaria.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Elizabeth de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos como harina, manteca, por kilos, mantequilla y huevos por decenas para preparar los ricos “panetones” para navidad.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a hard-working 22 year old woman.  She lives with her only son Rolando, who she cares for in her own home which is located in the city of Ataura.  She is a courageous single mother, and her life centers around caring for her son.  In order to do so, she carries out several economic enterprises.  During the morning she prepares the breads and pastries typical of the region, as she has to fulfill the requests that she receives.  She also sells in person at the Jauja farmer's market that occurs once a week.  In addition to all this, every afternoon she sells food to the construction workers who are building a local school and at night she sells hamburgers and shoe string fries with delicious sauces.  All of these jobs help her to be an independent woman and above all help her take care of her son, feed him, give him clothes and provide for his education.  What she wants the most is to see him grow and get ahead in life by getting a university degree.  She belongs to a unified group called Palomitas, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is thankful for your support, as it makes it possible for her to continue with her work.  She also promises to be punctual with her financial obligations, since it pleases her to work with such responsible and socially conscious people.  Elizabeth, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of supplies such as flour and animal fat (by the kilo) and butter and eggs (by the dozen) in order to prepare the tradtional and delicious Christmas bread called "panetones."

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs in order to make the holiday bread called "panetones".

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 50 años es una mujer alegre. Ella tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Yurica y Liz a las que cuida en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Su madre hace muchos años viajo a Estados Unidos, donde vive en la actualidad, por ello ella tuvo que encargarse de los bienes de la familia. Gracias a sus 7 parcelas, puede sembrar maíz, papa y habas en cantidad. Cuida con mucho esmero, pues es uno de los mejores de la zona. Cuenta que en donde gana más dinero, es en el maíz, ya que hace secar para venderlos por arrobas, eso es su técnica. También cría animales, ya tienen varias gallinas, 40 cuyes y 10 conejos, los cuales le brindan ganancias extra, ya que los engorda para luego vender a un mayor precio en la ciudad de Lima y Cerro de Pasco donde tiene buenos clientes, además aprovecha para visitar a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Gloria, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de maíz; ya que en esta temporada es donde más sale.
texts.en:
Gloria, 50, is a cheerful woman. She has 5 children but only 2 of them live with her: Yurica and Liz are the two she cares for in her mother's house, which is located in the town of Ataura.  Many years ago her mother went to the United States, where she lives now, so she had to take care of the family assets. Thanks to her 7 plots of land, Gloria can plant corn, potatoes and beans in bulk. She handles the farm with great care, so it is one of the best in the area. She says that where she earns more money is in corn, so she dries it to sell by the bushel; that's her technique. 

Gloria also raises animals and has several chickens, 40 guinea pigs and 10 rabbits, which gives her extra income.  She fattens the animals and then sells them at a higher price in the city of Lima and Cerro de Pasco where she has good clients.  She also takes the opportunity to visit her children. 

Gloria belongs to the Communal Bank "Palomitas (Popcorn)" and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She thanks all of you for your support; it makes it possible for her to continue with her work.  Gloria also promises to be punctual with her dues, and she likes working with people who are responsible and caring. Gloria, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested money in purchasing natural fertilizer for her crops of corn, because this is the harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Socias Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pantalones, tienda de carne, tejido de lana a macramé, venta de comida, ventad e chuño y papa, tienda de abarrotes.

La señora Rosa,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tiende a barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de viveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.
texts.en:
The “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” Communal Bank is starting out on their first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the field partner's local centre in the Andes. The group is made up of six members and directed by a board led by Señora Rosa. The businesses run by the members of the group include: making trousers, a butcher's shop, weaving string into macramé handicrafts, selling food, selling potatoes and dried potatoes, and selling groceries.

Señora Rosa says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the organisation after being invited by a promoter. She presently has a shop in her neighbourhood, where she has been working for several years, having learned her business from her mother-in-law. The loan she will recieve is to increase her capital, to buy groceries, which she will get from the La Ceja market, and which she will then sell in her store. This type of work enables her to generate income to support her family, as she is not married.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael reside en el municipio de Choloma. Tiene 39 años de edad y lleva 19 años con su pareja Ana, la cual es ama de casa. Ana tiene dos hijas de una relación anterior que viven con ellos. Las dos han terminado sus estudios. La familia depende de los ingresos de Rafael para sostenerse. 

Rafael se especializa en la compra, reparación y venta de electrónicos como televisores, equipos de sonido, ventiladores, etcétera. Desde pequeño aprendió el oficio de reparaciones electrónicas y luego comenzó a vender por su cuenta. Le generó buenos ingresos así que decidió empezar su propio negocio hace 4 años. Hoy en día dedica de 10 a 11 horas diarias al negocio. 

Con este crédito de L10,000, Rafael va a comprar electrónicos en mal estado para surtir su inventario. Desea crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the town of Choloma.  He’s 39 years old and has been together with his spouse, Ana, for 19 years; she’s a housewife.  Ana has two daughters from a prior relationship that live with them.  Both of them have completed their studies.  The family depends on Rafael’s income to support themselves.

Rafael works buying, repairing and then reselling electronic devices like television sets, sound equipment, fans, etc.  He learned how to repair electronic devices when still a young boy and then started selling on his own.  It produced good profits so he decided to start his own business four years ago.  Today, he dedicates 10 to 11 hours daily to the business.

With this L10,000 loan Rafael will buy electronic devices in poor condition to stock his inventory.  He wants to grow in business and move his family ahead with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy electronic devices in poor condition.

loans.name: Christian Rolando

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian tiene 37 años de edad, está acompañado con la Sra. Olga de 27 años, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos, quienes son el motor de la vida de ellos.
El Sr. Christian se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y bebidas, comenta que trabaja en esto hace 2 años. Anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en el exterior con su compañera, pero pudieron hacerse de capital para emprender el negocio, y en la actualidad ya les va muy bien, pues tienen muy buena clientela y muy buena venta.
Solicitó este crédito para la compra de bebidas, hamburguesas, tomates y demás, ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos. Tiene como anhelo ir creciendo día a día con su negocio para poder brindarles una vida digna a su familia.-
texts.en:
Señor Christian is 37 years old and lives with his partner, Señora Olga, who is 27. They are blessed with 2 children, who are the motivation for all that they do. 
Señor Christian works selling hamburgers and drinks, and has been doing so for 2 years. Previously he could be found working outdoors with Señora Olga, but they were able to raise enough capital to start their business, and it is now going very well. They have a good customer base adn very good sales. He is seeking the loan to buy drinks, hamburgers, tomatoes and other things, because there is great demand for his wares. He aims to go on growing the business day by day, so that he is able to offer his family a decent life.

loans.use: To buy hamburgers and drinks to stock his snack-bar.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia 
Puntarenas
300000
	Elia tiene una panadería en la zona de Puntarenas, a pesar de lo cercano de la ciudad ella vive en un lugar de bastante pobreza y donde el comercio existente  es poco, provee a los habitantes del lugar la venta de pan fresco para su desayuno diario. La Panadería Elia tiene más de 10 años de existir, es un negocio familiar, ella trabaja con su esposo e hijos. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en la reparación de horno para incrementar así la producción de su pan.
	Su día inicia a las 4 de la mañana cuando se empieza a hornear el pan que se prepara la noche anterior, la panadería empieza a vender a partir de la 5:30 am por lo que la labor empieza desde tempranas horas de la mañana, sus hijos son mayores de edad por lo que no tiene que ir a la escuela, más bien entre todos apoyan la labor de esta microempresa, ya que también se distribuye el producto en pulperías de la zona, mejorando así los ingresos de la actividad y expandiendo sus operaciones para dar a conocer su producto.
	Entre sus metas esta mejorar su equipo, modernizándolo para mejorar la calidad del mismo y la eficiencia en su producción. Abrir sucursales y mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Ella emigró de Nicaragua en los años 80, y se estableció aquí con sus hijos, a los que les dio educación y les enseño un oficio, que ahora ellos practican, una  de sus hijas tiene otra panadería. 
	Su negocio ha caminado muy bien, ya tiene cerca de 10 años de trabajar en este, por lo que el principal problema  es la falta de dinero para invertir en el mismo, pero con la oportunidad brindada por Fundación Mujer por medio de KIVA, con este préstamo se va a mejorar mucho la capacidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Elia has a bakery in Puntarenas. Although it is close to the city, the area where she lives is very poor. The little commercial activity that exists there is small scale. Elia provides the local residents with fresh bread each day. Her bakery, Panadería Elia, has been around for more than 10 years, nad is a family business where she works with her husband and children. The purpose of the loan is to invest in getting an oven repaired to increase the quantity of bread they make. 

Her day begins at 4am when she starts baking the bread she has prepared the night before. The bakery opens for business at 5.30am for people who have to to work early in the morning. Their children are grown up and don't have to go to school, so they can help by working in the bakery and by distributing the produce to local grocery stores, which increases the income to the business and expands the operation to get their products known. 

Among their goals are to improve the bakery's equipment, modernising it to improve the quality and effiicency of production. They would like to open other branches of the business and to improve the family's standard of living. Elia emigrated from Nicaragua in the 1980s, and established herself here with her children, whom she has given both an education and a trade for them to follow. One of her daughters now runs a bakery of her own.

Her business has progressed well in the past 10 years. The main problem has been the lack of money to invest back into the business, but with the opportunity offered through Fundación Mujer and KIVA, this loan means she can greatly increase the capacity of her business.

loans.use: To repair an oven for bread-making.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel de 46 años de edad  es una mujer casada que vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 17 a 25 años de edad. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, negocio que inició entusiasmada por su prima, quien estaba vinculada a una empresa de productos a través de guías especializadas; Maribel en un principio compraba estos productos mediante el código de su prima y los pagaba en dos partidas;  en la medida en que incrementó su clientela, se vinculó directamente y hoy es ella quien los ofrece y con ello ha logrado mucha más utilidades,  así como premios  y esto obedece al enfoque altamente comercial de Maribel. 
 En la actualidad maneja la misma estrategia con otra amiga y en su casa posee una vitrina, en la que exhibe sus productos, pues quiere convertir su punto comercial en una gran miscelánea,  con mucho surtido, para que su clientela encuentre todo lo que busca y no la cambien por su competencia.  Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su familia y por eso sus sueños de hacerlo crecer no se detienen, esta es la razón por la que acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues quiere acceder a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía variada y  una nueva vitrina, que surtiría totalmente y con ello será exitosa,  pues aplicará esta estrategia de inversión,  en una época en que tradicionalmente hay un importante repunte de las ventas,  como lo es el final del año, que se viene con primas bonificaciones y mucha fiesta.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 46 year-old married woman who lives in a neighborhood called Simón Bolívar with her husband and 2 children, ages 17 and 25. She does retail sales of a wide array of products. Her cousin, who participated in an enterprise’s catalogue sales scheme, motivated her to start her business.
In the beginning, Maribel used to buy her products with her cousin’s code, paying them in two installments. As her clientele increased, she subscribed directly to the enterprise. This has brought her greater profits and prizes thanks to her highly commercial profile. 
Currently, Maribel uses the same strategy with another friend. She has a display case in her house where she exhibits her products. She wants to turn her selling point into a big miscellaneous store, fully stocked, so her clients can find everything they are looking for and don’t go to the competition.
With her business, Maribel has been able to support her family’s wellbeing. That is why she can’t stop dreaming about making her business grow. It is also why she turned to our institution asking for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy diverse products and a display case that will be fully stocked. She expects to be successful because she will use this investment strategy at a time of the year where sales usually rise. Namely, the end of the year, when people receive extra salaries and bonuses and there are a lot of celebrations going on.

loans.use: to purchase different products and a display case for exhibiting them

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada, con hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Benita es dueña de una pequeña despensita.
La señora empezó vendiendo mandioca y verduras en un carro por la zona de Bertoni, y sueño era de tener un puesto de venta en el mercado de Santaní, cosa no se le dio por la circunstancias de la vida, entonces siguió su trabajo de siempre hasta que llegó a poner un copetín en su casa y con el pasar de los tiempos concretó su sueño de tener una despensa y ventas de verduras en su propio domicilio, gracias también a la ayuda que la Fundación Paraguaya le brinda por cada crédito que le otorga.
Esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, panificados, y demás insumos para abastecer su negocio, pues siempre tiene muchos clientes y le gustaría estar siempre lista. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en: Señora Benita is from the city of Santaní. She is married with children, and her husband is a farmer. Benita runs a small grocery store. She started out selling cassava and vegetables from a cart around the Bertoni district, and dreamt of having a fixed location in the market in Santaní - something that her circumstances then would not allow. So she kept working and working until she was able to set up a snack bar in her house, and over time she realised her dream of having a grocery and selling vegetables from her own premises. This was thanks also to the support of Fundación Paraguaya who granted her the loans she sought. This time she is seeking a loan to buy foods, drinks, baked goods, and other groceries to stock her business, because she always has a lot of customers and she likes to be ready to serve them. She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are offering.

loans.use: To buy foods, drinks, baked goods, and other grocery items

loans.name: Bautista Triunfador Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BAUTISTA TRIUNFADOR” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Verónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de gelatina, carpintería, costura, tejido de mantas.

La señora Verónica,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tiende a barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de las mayoristas y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bautista Triunfador will begin its first cycle as part of the Los Andes regional office and it is made up of 7 members with a board headed by Verónica. The members of the communal bank have various businesses among which are neighborhood grocery store, selling gelatin, carpentry, seamstress, and knitting blankets.

Verónica says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the communal bank through a promotional invitation. Currently she has a neighborhood grocery store where she has been working for some years.

She will use the money from this loan to increase her capital so she can buy groceries from wholesalers and then sell them later in her business. This form of work permits her to earn income in order to support her family. She is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Gabriel es padre D. familia y esta construyendo un cuarto en L. planta alta D. su casa. 
Al terminar L. recamara tendrá mas espacio en su vivienda, ya que actualmente cuenta con un solo cuarto y le esta haciendo falta otro el cuarto que será para su hija quien esta creciendo y necesita su propio espacio en L. casa. 
Don Gabriel trabaja en una compañía D. transportes desD. hace más D. once años  y su esposo trabaja en L. limpieza D. casas particulares desD. hace 7 años. El mejoramiento D. L. vivienda es para brindar le comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Gabriel is the father of a family, and he is building a room on the second story of his house.  When he finishes the bedroom he will have more space in his home.  Currently he has only one bedroom and he needs another one for his daughter, who is growing up and needs her own space in the house.

Gabriel has worked for a transportation company for more than eleven years and his wife has worked cleaning private homes for seven years.

The home improvement is to give his family comfort.

loans.use: to finish a room on the second story.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Martires is the coordinator of her group, Cristo es la esperanza 1 & 2 (Christ is the hope). All the members of this group are Haitians and they are located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to recover the payment when she gives credit to her clients.

Martires is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around 16 years, starting with a small amount of capital that she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy some sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, plantain, flour, etc. She operates a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, just a short walk from any home. With her business profits she has been improving her business

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, plantain, flour, etc

loans.name: Ariel Esneider

texts.es:
El señor Ariel a sus 22 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propia tienda desde hace un año, en la cual vende productos como granos, frutas y verduras, snakcs, helados, productos para el aseo personal y para el hogar. El señor Ariel trabaja solo de lunes a lunes en el horario de 7:00 am a 10 pm. Esta actividad de la tienda la aprendió de manera autónoma y sin ayuda de nadie.
Actualmente el señor Ariel desea comprar más surtido para su tienda como granos, frutas y verduras, snakcs, helados y productos navideños, esto con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.  A futuro el señor Ariel desea tener su tienda más grande en la cual pueda trabajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ariel is 22 years old and has been working in his own store for a year. He sells products such as grains, fruits and vegetables, snacks, ice cream, personal hygiene items, and supplies for the home. Ariel works alone 7 days a week from 7:00AM until 10:00PM. He learned the grocery business on his own without help from anyone.

Right now Ariel wants to buy more selections for his store such as grains, fruits and vegetables, snacks, ice cream and items for Christmas. This will increase his income and the quality of life for him and his family. In the future Ariel wants to have a larger store in which he can work with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruit and vegetables, snacks, ice cream, and sweets

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar, de 31 años de edad, habitante de Condega municipio de Estelí, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad. El es comerciante dueño de una pulpería. Comenzó con este negocio Hace 5 años cuando regreso de Costa Rica en donde trabajo y con lo que gano regreso  a su pueblo y estableció su pulpería  con ayuda de su madre y su esposa el administra la venta donde el realiza las comprar para surtir la venta y ellas le ayudan atender ele negocio. Adicional el da clases de ingles en un instituto vocacional para jóvenes donde este tipo de enseñanzas en muy poca ya que la mayoría de los jóvenes e dedican a labores del campo y no tienen mucho acceso económico para estudiar. 
El requiere el préstamo para surtir su pulpería de productos tales como enlatados, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos, pan, leche, huevo, pollo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite ya que son parte del inventario que más buscan sus clientes y de los cuales necesita mantener surtida su pulpería para vender. Entre sus planes según nos cuenta el desea convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Cesar, 31, lives in a neighborhood of Esteli called Condega.  He has an 11-year old son.  He owns a general store, a business that he started 5 years ago after returning from Costa Rica.  He used the money that he earned before to stock the store and his wife and mother help him tend it.  He also teaches English to young people at a local vocational school.  The classes are welcome because it's not easy for local youths, most of whom work on area farms, to raise enough money to pay school fees.
Cesar will use the loan to buy supplies of canned goods, detergents, soft drinks, juices, bread, milk, eggs, chicken, rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil, all of which are products that his customers most want to buy.  In the future, he would like to develop a wholesale supply business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals and supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Maria Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva es una señora de 55 años de edad quien vive con su hija en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
Minerva se dedica a la costura. Ella brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente Minerva está solicitando un microcrédito de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de una máquina de coser, ya que quiere solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar.
Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Minerva es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Minerva, 55, lives with her daughter in Trinchera del Pital, a small town in Alajuela province.  Farming and livestock-rearing are the base for the local economy.  Pineapples, most of which are grown for export, are especially important here and have contributed to the town's prosperity.  Economic growth has generated an increase in demand for products and services, along with new jobs.   
Minerva is a seamstress.  She provides sewing services to people in the area who come to her because of the quality of her work.  She's applying for a small loan of 500,000.00 (five-hundred thousand) colones that she will use to buy a sewing machine.  The extra income will allow her to contribute to supporing her family.  
Minerva hopes the investment will allow her small business to keep on growing.  She wants to add customers and provide better quality merchandise.  She hopes, in turn, that the investment will approve her quality of life.  
Minerva is a member of the Mujeres al Exito community bank in Trinchera de Pital.  The group is one of 150 groups sponsored by EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan and she hopes it will contribute to her personal growth as well as her family's well-being.  She also wants to play a part in fostering this kind of lending in her community.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her clothing business.

loans.name: El 13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo 13 lo conforman tres perdonas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Andrea de 56 años quien  todos los fines de semanas tiene una fritanga. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de pasteles y poco a poco fue aumentando e invirtiendo en otros rubros.

Las otras integrantes son Silvia de 26 años quien tiene un tortillería y Marisol de 39 años quien vende productos Avon.
texts.en: The El 13 Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is 56-year-old Andrea who runs a fried food stand on weekends.  She started this business selling cakes and little by little she expanded it and invested in other areas.  The other group members are 26-year-old Silvia who has a tortilla shop and 39-year-old Marisol who sells Avon products.

loans.use: to buy groceries, meat, cabbage, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Norma quien vende fritanga desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo inicio vendiendo verduras poco a poco comenzó a invertir en otros rubros con el crédito anterior compró peroles, estufas y productos para la fritanga.
Con el préstamo comprará materia primapara el negocio (granos basicos, queso, carne, leña...etc.) para  salir adelante.
Los otros integrantes son Misael quien tiene un taxi desde hace 8 años e invertirá en mantenimiento y Hazel de 26 años vende cosméticos, ropa, fresco y helados desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Group Fe (Faith) comprises three hardworking entrepreneurial people. One of them is Norma. She has been selling fried food for the last seven years. She started out selling vegetables and little by little started investing in other activities. With her previous loan, she bought pots, stoves and other products used for preparing fried food. This loan will help her to purchase supplies that will help her get through.
The other members of the group are Misael, who has owned a taxi for eight years and plans to invest in its maintenance, and Hazel, 26, who has been selling make-up, clothes, drinks and ice cream for the last four years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, basic grains, cheese, and meat for a food stand.

loans.name: Juana Estela

texts.es:
Con el préstamo la señora Juana Estela podrá surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de mercancía que le están solicitando que tenga a la venta en su negocio. 
Doña Juana Estela  tiene aproximadamente dos años con su negocio en el cual su esposo le apoya a tender a los clientes, cuando no tiene trabajo de albañilería, con estos ingresos solventan los gastos de manutención de sus cinco hijos, cuyas edades son de entre 8 años y 2 años de edad.
texts.en:
With this loan, Juana Estela will be able to stock her business and offer her customers the diversity they are demanding.
Juana Estela has had this business for approximately two years. When not working in construction, her husband helps her to serve her customers. This income helps them cover the maintenance expenses of their five children, aged 8 to 2.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su propia casa con su esposa e hijos. Tiene 55 años de edad, tiene varios hijos que ya son todos adultos.
Es el dueño de una despensa, comenta que hace ya 10 años que mantiene su negocio, por lo que ya tiene bastante experiencia en el comercio. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por tener una vejez digna y decorosa, ya que no quiere ser molestia para nadie.
En cuanto a su negocio ya tiene muy buena clientela y siempre tiene muchos pedidos, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás productos,con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is from Santaní City. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is 55 and has several children, all of whom are adults.
He says he has had his business for ten years so he has a lot of experience in commerce. He says he makes all this effort in order to live decently in his old age. He does not want to depend on anyone.
As to his business, he already has a very good clientele and always has a very high demand. That is why he is asking for a loan in order to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products that will allow him to stock his business and meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Osman Ferney

texts.es: El Señor Osman a sus 26 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en la construcción cuando es contratado con personas naturales o con contratistas del municipio de Marinilla ubicado al oriente de Medellín. Esta labor la realiza Osman desde hace varios años y le ha permitido llevar las obligaciones de su hogar y su familia. El señor Osman desea comprar herramienta de trabajo como lo son una pulidora y un taladro, que le permitan realizar con mayor facilidad su trabajo y no tenga que estar prestando la herramienta con otras personas. Con lo anterior su calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familiar podrá aumentar.
texts.en:
Osman is 26 years old. He works in construction.

He has done contract work for individuals and for the Marinilla municipality located east of Medellín. Osman has done this work for several years and it has permitted him to cover the household and family expenses. 

Osman wants to buy work-tools such as a polisher and a drill, which will make his work easier and he would not have to borrow tools from other people. This would allow the quality of life and wellbeing of his family to increase.

loans.use: to buy work-tools such as a polisher and a drill

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora, vive en compañía de Evadio su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen una hija, “Andrea” a la que cuidan en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. A pesar de no contar con terrenos propios, ella obtiene buenas ganancias, pues busca socias quienes le brindan terrenos productivos para sembrar a cambio de que ella cuide los cultivos y fertilice. El dinero de la cosecha lo reparten de manera equitativa. Sus alimentos constan de, papa, alfalfa, habas y maíz. Ya tiene 4 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo también se dedicó al cuidado de sus animales como: ovejas, vacas y cuyes, los que vende a los carniceros, cuando tiene algún apuro. Ahora sembrará papa y desea comprar más ovejas; pues está esperando a su esposo que trabaja en la mina de Casapalca, el llega después de 15 días, para ayudar a voltear la tierra y en otras labores agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Rosa, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de alfalfa para sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is a hardworking, 38 year old woman, has lived with her husband Evadio for eight years. The two of them have a daughter, Andrea, who is being raised in her mother's house, which is located in the town of Ataura. 

Although she does not have her own land, she makes a good profit. She is looking for partners who will offer her fertile land for planting in exchange for her looking after and fertilizing the crops. They would split the money from the harvest fairly.  

Her crops are potatoes, alfalfa, beans, and corn. She has four years of experience, during which she has also made a living caring for animals like sheep, cows, and guinea pigs, which she sells to butchers when needed. Now she will plant potatoes and wants to buy more sheep, but she is waiting for her husband, who works in the Casapalca mine. He comes back in 15 days to to help till the land and do other agricultural work.  

Rosa belongs to the solidarity group “palomitas” [little doves], and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful for all of your help, since you make it possible for her to continue working. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual in her payments, since it is a pleasure to work with supportive and responsible people. Rosa, upon receiving your help, will put the money towards buying alfalfa for her animals.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa as feed for her animals.

loans.name: Damasco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Damasco está conformado por  mujeres trabajadora y emprendedora  una de ellas es Ivania de 40 años quien vende nacatamales y  perfumes desde hace 6 años. Su meta es expandir el negocio con más clientes y por hacer autosuficiente al negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Claudia quien vende ropa y medicamentos naturales, Silvia  vende tamales pisque y vende ropa, y Emerita vende ropa y sandalias.
texts.en:
The Damasco Group is made up of hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is 40-year-old Ivania who has been selling Nicaraguan tamales and perfume for six years.  Her goal is to expand her business with more customers and to make her business self sufficient.

The other group members are Claudia, who sells clothes and natural remedies, Silvia, who sells pisque tamales and clothes, and Emerita, who sells clothes and sandals.

loans.use: To buy corn, pork, basic grains, meat and clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 57 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y 3 nietos; en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Hace 6 años enviudó y cargo consigo muchas dificultades que afrontó sola, una de ellas es cuidar de su hija mayor que es minusválida, pues no puede caminar. Eso la motiva mucho más, comenzando a trabajar con ahínco para tener un negocio propio y de esa manera solventar su economía. Es así que abrieron un restaurante en la plaza de su zona, ahí los turistas y la población la visita con frecuencia, pues saben de la exquisita sazón de María. Pero como ella es una mujer del campo, también siembra maíz y papa en grandes cantidades, los cuales realiza en terrenos agrícolas alquilados, pues no cuenta con unos propios. Ahora desea juntar el dinero necesario para poder comparar terrenos productivos y minimizar los costos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Hacienda” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. María, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
María who is 57 years old is an admirable woman. She lives with her three children and 3 grandchildren in her own house located in the town of Ataura. 

She became a widow 6 years ago and has faced many difficulties. One of these is the care of her oldest daughter who is disabled and not able to walk. This was a major motivation for working enthusiastically to have her own business and in this way to earn money. So she opened a restaurant in the town square where the tourists and local people often go, knowing about María’s exquisite flavors. 

But as she is also a field worker, she also grows large quantities of corn and potatoes on farming land which she currently rents, which is not the same as having her own. Now she wants to gather the money necessary to buy productive land to minimize costs.

She belongs to the communal bank Hacienda and this is the 4th loan with MFP, where she feels happy as she receives your support, all of you who have permitted her to continue in her business. Also, she promises to be punctual in her loan payments, because the communal bank is made up of trustworthy and caring people.
