María, upon receiving help, will use the money from the loan to buy natural fertilizers to spread about her corn crops

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella está casada. Ella es comerciante, es dueña de un local de una peluqueria que realiza trabajos de todo tipo en cuanto a trabajos de belleza integral.
Ella comenta que trabaja arduamente todos los días, pues siempre tiene muchos clientes, hace 10 años que se dedica a esto y es por ello que ya tiene una vasta experiencia. Comenta que gracias a este negocio ella puede ayudar en la casa, con ello puede ayudar a su marido a aligerar un poco la carga del hogar.
Debido a lo bien que le esta yendo, ella quiere abastecer su negocio, con todos los insumos fundamentales para su peluquería, como ser: tintes, esmaltes para uñas, limas, quita esmaltes, químicos para tratamientos y demás. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva, por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sonia is from the city of Pilar.  She is married.  She is a businesswoman; she owns a station in a hair salon that offers all kinds of services in terms of comprehensive beauty.

She tells us that she works hard every day, as she always has a lot of clients.  She has been doing this for ten years now, so she has a lot of experience.  She says that, thanks to this business, she is able to help at home; it allows her to help her husband lighten the household load.

Since her business is going so well, she wants to stock it up with all the fundamental supplies for her hair salon, such as dyes, nail polish, nail files, nail polish remover, chemicals for treatments, and more.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they have given her, as the loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish, nail files, nail polish remover, chemicals, and more

loans.name: Jenny Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Jenny a sus 21 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 5 años, ella se dedica desde hace varios años y en compañía de su esposo al cultivo de maíz. Debido a la temporada invernal que ha afectado su cultivo, la señora Jenny requiere de la compra de insumos para su cultivo como riegos y abonos para fortalecerlo. Con lo anterior, la señora Jenny podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y esposo.  A futuro la señora Jenny sueña con tener su propia finca y ver crecer a su hijo en un ambiente sano y lleno de amor.
texts.en: Jenny, 21, has a 5-year old son.  For some years she and her husband have planted corn.  The winter weather affected the plants and Jenny needs to buy supplies for them such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment  to strengthen the crop.   Jenny used the previous loan to give her husband and son a better quality of life.  She dreams of having her own farm in the future and to see her son grow up healthy and full of love.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment for the corn crop

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana, D. 64 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Celso, con quien se casó desD. hace 44 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con una D. ellas en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. Ataura.  A pesar D. su edad, es una mujer que no descansa. Sufrió la pérdida D. uno D. sus hijos, para ella fue muy triste, pero sabe que tiene que luchar por los que aún viven. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra papa, maíz, trigo, alverja, habas y alfalfa. Ya tiene 24 años dedicándose a esto, sus principales cosechas los comercializa a la ciudad D. Lima, Oroya y Jauja, “depenD. del precio en el mercado”, afirma. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir 5 hectáreas D. terrenos productivos, animales como vacas, terneras y cuyes; que le generan un dinero extra. Ahora aprovecha la llegada D. una empresa importante D. telefonía, a quienes prepara los alimentos del día a cambio D. un pago mensual, por lo que ahora está obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos para el hogar. Ella pertenece al bA. comunal “hacienda” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo D. todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Viviana D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos D. maíz y papa “yungay” que recién sembrará.
texts.en:
Viviana is 64 years old and a working woman. She lives with her husband Celso and they have been married 44 years. They have 5 children, but only one lives with them, in their own house, located in the town of Ataura. Despite her age, she is a woman who does not rest. She suffered the loss of one of her children, and was very sad, but she knows that she has to fight for the ones that are still alive. 

Her main economical activity is agriculture. She grows potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, beans and alfalfa. She has been doing this for 24 years. She sells most of the crops in Lima, Oroya and Jauja, “depending on the market price”, she says. During this time she was able to buy 5 hectares of productive land, and animals such as cows, calves and guinea pigs, which bring in extra income. Now she is taking advantage of the arrival of an important telephone service, preparing daily food in exchange for a monthly payment, so now she is saving money on her household expenses. 

She belongs to the community bank “Hacienda” and this is the 3rd loan with MFP, where she feels happy, because she receives the help of all of you, permitting her to go on with her business. Also, she promises to be punctual in her loan payments, as the community bank is maD. up of responsible and caring people. Upon receiving help she will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread about her corn and yungay potatoes (similar to a yellow potato) that were recently planted.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yessie Mercedes

texts.es: Yessie está estudiando Contabilidad, está cursando el último año de su carrera y solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Su inspiración ha sido su madre, ya que ella siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar a Yessie adelante y a motivarla para que nunca dejara de estudiar. Después de finalizar su carrera, seguirá estudiando, sacará una especialización para ser Auditor. Le dedica mucho tiempo a sus estudios, diariamente después del trabajo pasa algunas horas reforzando sus estudios.
texts.en: Yessie is studying accounting and is in the final year of her career and is asking for a loan in order to pay for the last year of studies. Her inspiration has been her mother, because she always has searched for ways to motivate Yessie to get ahead and to never stop studying. After she attains her degree, she will continue to study, going for a specialization in order to be an auditor. She studies all the time, daily, and after work she keeps reinforcing her studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her last year of study to obtain her degree

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 3, 5 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 3, 4 & 5 (Christ is the hope). She lives with her long-term partner and their four children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugar cane workers where she, her family and the other 14 micro-entrepreneur women in this group reside.

Yolanda says that her most important challenge is to have a house in the main city and to raise, educate and support her children in all they may need. She operates a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally colmados are in the same neighborhood, just a short walk from any home. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, canned food, cooking oil, flour, etc. 

Part of this group for almost a year, Yolanda is excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Yolanda thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, canned food, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Isabe

texts.es: Isabe, de 25 años es una madre responsable. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Xiomara y Mayte a los que cuidan en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Como una reciente pareja con responsabilidades. Ellos distribuyen sus actividades, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de carpintería, soldadura y mantenimiento del gobierno local de su zona, ahí obtiene un dinero mensual, que le paga el estado peruano. Además ella se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 30 ejemplares, los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Jauja, durante la feria. Pero la actividad que realizan juntos es la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz, papa y habas, los que realizan en terrenos agrícolas heredados, “eso me permite ahorrar mucho”, afirma. Ahora planean comprar sus casa propia, saben que con trabajo y ahorro lo lograrán. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Isabe de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de alfalafa.
texts.en: Isabe is 25 years old and is a responsible mother.  She lives with Juan, her husband of 7 years.  They have 2 children, Xiomara and Mayte, who live with them in their in-laws’ home, located in the community of Ataura.  As a young couple with responsibilities they divide up their activities.  Juan makes a living from carpentry, welding, and doing maintenance work for the local government of their region, from which he earns a monthly income from the Peruvian government.  Isabe makes a living raising guinea pigs—she has 30 of them, which she sells in the city of Jauja during its festival.  The economic activity that the couple work on together, though, is farming: they grow corn, potatoes, and beans on their family’s agricultural fields, which, as Isabe says, “allows me to save a lot.”  They are now planning to purchase their own house, and they know that with hard work and saving they will achieve it.  Isabe belongs to the “Hacienda” communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to receive your support, which will enable her to stay in business.  She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, since her group is made up of responsible and supportive individuals.  If Isabe receives your support then she will invest the money in purchasing seeds and natural fertilizer for her next crop of alfalfa.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa seeds and bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Jhossy

texts.es:
Jhossy, de 27 años es un hijo responsable; vive en compañía de su mamá Gudelia, su papá Cirilo y su hermano pequeño Miguel a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Él trabajo al que se dedica este ejemplar hijo es la crianza de ovejas de raza “Junín”, que es su principal especialidad; ya que aprendió a cuidarlos y reproducirlos, pues tiene clientes ganaderos que compran sus ejemplares para sus rebaños, en especial machos que les sirven como reproductores. “Esta actividad es mi principal distracción”, comenta. Además estudió la carrera de ingeniería informática, ahora se encuentra trabajando en un hospital del estado peruano en esa área, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia, pues apoya a su mamá en los gastos del hogar. Entre sus planes se encuentra seguir estudiando y abrir un negocio sólido que le permita sostener sus gastos a largo plazo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.
Jhossy de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas de raza, para dinamizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jhossy is 27 years old. A responsible son, he lives in his own house in the community of Ataura with his mother Gudelia, his father Cirilo and his little brother Miguel, whom he provides for. This exemplary son is a shepherd and he breeds “Junín” sheep. This is his main specialty, as he has learned how to grow and breed them, because of some stockbreeders among his customers who buy his animals for their flocks, particularly rams needed for reproduction. “This activity is my main pastime” he says. He has also studied electronic and computing engineering, and he is now working in a Peruvian public hospital in his area. The monthly wage he earns from this job helps him providing economic stability to his family, as he support his mother in the payment of household expenses. Keeping on studying and establishing a strong activity that will help him paying for his expenses in the long ruin are two of his goals. He is a member of the Hacienda (“Ranch”) Communal Bank, and this is his third loan with MFP; he is happy about this because of the support he receives from all of you, thanks to which he is able to carry on with his activity. He commits to being punctual in repaying his dues, since, like all the members of his Communal Bank, he is a very responsible and caring person.
With your support, Jhossy will invest the requested loan in the purchase of thoroughbred sheep in order to invigorate his activity.

loans.use: To buy thoroughbred sheep.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 42 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su hijos de 15 y 24 años de edad; allí se dedica a la fabricación y venta de alimentos; sus principales productos son las hayacas: Amasijo de maíz, o arroz, relleno de verduras y carnes, envueltas en hojas de bijao;   oficio que aprendió por tradición familiar, pues en Ocaña un municipio de Norte de Santander,  vio desde muy niña como sus grupo familiar preparaba el delicioso producto, que Maria perfecciono con el tiempo, especialmente cuando emigró de su natal Ocaña en busca de oportunidades, hacia la Costa Caribe de Colombia. Cuando inició lo hizo con un pequeño capital, llevando productos de tienda en tienda en su barrio, muy pronto empezó a extenderse hacia las comunidades aledañas, donde por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios ha logrado concentrarse. Hoy quiere crecer aún más y ha escogido el mes de Diciembre, donde no solo las hayacas son compradas para venderlas, sino también para consumirlas directamente y esto es justamente lo que logrará impactar aún más sus ventas y con ello su crecimiento. Su sueño es lograr aumentar sus ingresos para continuar apoyando los estudios profesionales que iniciará su hija en el año 2012.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, para lograr descuentos, y tambien invertirá en una picadora, con la cual preparará sus hayacas de una manera más efectiva y dar respuesta oportuna a sus clientes, en estas alegres fiestas de fin de año, donde todos comparten comida y abundancia.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her partner and her children who are 15 and 24 years old. She prepares and sells food. Her main product is hayacas: a dough made of corn or rice, filled with vegetables and meat, and wrapped in banana leaves. She first learned through family tradition, in Ocaña a town north of Santander. She watched from the time she was a young girl at family gatherings the preparation of this delicious food, which Maria perfected over time, especially when she emigrated from her birthplace of Ocaña in search of opportunities toward the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

She began with little funding, carrying her products from store to store in her neighborhood. Very soon she began to fan out to surrounding communities focusing on the quality of her products and good prices.

Today she wants to expand even more and has chosen the month of December, because not only are the hayacas purchased for resale, but also for immediate consumption, so this is just what she will accomplish, the sales will increase and so will her growth.

Her dream is to increase her profit in order to be able to continue supporting her daughter and paying for the professional studies that she will begin in 2012. At this time she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first loan that will be made through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, in order to obtain discounts, and also to buy a chopper with which to prepare hayacas in a more effective way, and to meet the requests of her clients during these Happy New Year celebrations where everyone shares food and abundance.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, to receive a discount, and a chopper to use while preparing hayacas

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El señor Luis Fernando a sus 63 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace 17 años. Esta labor de ordeño de vacas la prendió desde niño de su padre quien en su finca tenía varias vacas. En 1997, el señor Luis Fernando decide independizarse y tener su propio negocio de venta de leche a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Actualmente, el señor Luis Fernando desea comprar otra vaca lechera que le permita incrementar la venta de leche y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En un futuro el señor Luis Fernando desea tener un mayor número de vacas y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Luis Fernando is 63 years old. He has sold milk for 17 years. Working with cows started when he was a child since his father had some cows on his farm. In 1997, Luis Fernando decided make himself independent and to start his own business selling milk to his neighbors, friends and relatives. Now, Luis Fernando wants to buy another dairy cow to increase his milk sales. With this, he can increase his income and give his family a better quality of life. In the future, Luis Fernando wants to have a larger number of cows and generate jobs in his community.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celia Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Celia Aydee esta casada y tiene una hija de diez años de edad. 
Solicita un préstamo para la construcción del bardal alrededor de su casa ya que necesita comprar el material que es block, arena, cemento y varilla. Y así su familia se sentirá más protegida y segura  ya que la señora Celia Aydee y su esposo el señor Antonio deseen darle lo mejor, por lo cual Doña Celia Aydee trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular y Don Antonio empleado de una centro comercial.
texts.en:
Celia Aydee is married. She has a daughter who is ten years old.
She is requesting a loan for the construction of a wall around her house. Now she needs buy supplies like bricks, sand, cement and bars. With this, her family will feel more protected and safer. Celia Aydee and Antonio, her husband, want to give their family the best. Celia Aydee works as a domestic worker in a private home. Antonio works in shopping center.

loans.use: build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Cristhian Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Cristhian tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres. Nos cuenta que tiene Despensa en la Ciudad de Villarrica, el cual está en un lugar bastante conocido en el centro y además muy concurrido.
Heredo el negocio de su madre, quien ya tenia una buena cantidad de clientes, pero el lo fue mejorando el negocio y ahora ya es más que exitoso. El joven hoy en día se encarga de la administración, y el local permanece abierto hasta alta horas de la noche.
Acude a Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda, que quiere invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás, con lo cual puede abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a young man of 26. He is single and lives with his parents. He talks about his general store in the city of Villarrica, which is well-known in the city center and also a busy area. 

He inherited this business from his mother, who already had a good number of customers. However, he continued to improve it, and today it is more than successful. Today, this young man is in charge of managing the business, and the store remains open late into the night. 

He came to the Fundación Paraguaya to gain access to a small amount of help, which he would like to invest in buying products of daily use, such as sugar, noodles, rice, yerba maté, and other items, with which he can stock his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, yerba maté and other products.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Johnatan, de 26 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Elena en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Él es un joven con aspiraciones, hace poco terminó la carrera técnica de agronomía. Desde ese entonces son 4 años de experiencia sembrando maíz, de calidad en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que le fueron heredados de parte de sus madre, a quien quiere mucho. Gracias a su conocimiento logró adquirir buenos ingresos, ahora desea ampliar sus conocimientos con una carrera universitario, eso es su objetivo. Para ello formó una empresa de carpintería y construcción de obras de infraestructura para el sector público y privado. Gana muy bien en estas actividades, por eso está pensando contratar a profesionales para ampliar sus ganancias y tener más clientes. Él pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Johnatan, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y herramientas para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en: Jonathan, age 26, is a responsible man. He lives together with his mother, Elena, in their own house, located in the town of Ataura. He is a young man with aspirations, who recently completed a technical degree in agronomy. Since that time, he has had 4 years of experience growing high-quality corn on his own farmlands. This land was passed on to him by his mother, whom he loves very much. Thanks to his knowledge, he has been able to achieve a good level of income. Now he would like to broaden his knowledge with a university degree, which is his objective. For this purpose, he formed a company providing carpentry services and infrastructural project construction for the public and private sectors. He earns very well from these activities, and thus he is thinking of contracting professionals to broaden his earnings and have more customers. He belongs to the "Hacienda" communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP, where he feels happy because he receives support from all of you, who permit him to continue with his business. He also promises to be punctual with his loan payments, since his association is made up of responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. When he receives this support, Jonathan will invest the funds he is requesting in buying natural fertilizers and tools to maintain his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy tools and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 44 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en casa de su padre, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura; en compañía de sus 4 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad, Ella trabaja en diversas actividades, pues gusta de estar activa y sentirse desarrollada. Durante las mañanas se dedica a la venta de gelatina, tamales y rajadas de laña, en un cuarto que acondicionó en su casa, es muy conocida tanto así que tiene clientes fijos; los que todos los días consumen los ricos alimentos que prepara. Por otro lado, también siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues en cada cosecha los comerciantes mayoristas la visitan en sus mismos terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 24 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo aprendió a ahorrar, por ello cuenta con animales como: vacas, becerros y toros, los cuales vende cuando están maduros. Ahora comenzó a trabajar para el estado en una obra de carreteras, donde recibe un sueldo fijo, por lo que dure su contrato planea ahorrar para mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda. Ella pertenece al bA. comunal “hacienda” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. María, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de árboles para realizar leña, asimismo en insumos para le elaboración de gelatina y tamal para su negocio.
texts.en:
María, age 44, is a responsible woman. She lives at her father’s house, which is located in the town of Ataura, with her four siblings who are all grown. María works in different business activities because she enjoys being active and developing as a person. In the mornings she sells gelatins, tamales, and chopped firewood from a room in her house that is suitable for this business. She is well-known and has established customers who eat the delicious dishes she prepares every day. María also grows corn, potatoes, and alfafa and looks after her crops with great care. The wholesale merchants come to her land during each harvest. María has 24 years of experience. During this entire time, she has learned how to save in order to acquire animals such as cows, calves, and bulls that she sells once they have matured. María has now started a job with the state in which she works on a highway project. Through the duration of her contract, she plans to save toward making improvements to the infrastructure of her shop.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Hacienda” and is taking her third loan with MFP. She is pleased with the support she has received from everyone. In addition, she promises to be prompt with her payments. Her Communal Bank consists of responsible and supportive individuals. María will invest the money she requested in the purchase of tree trunks for making firewood. She will also buy supplies for making gelatins and tamales for her business.

loans.use: to buy tree trunks for firewood and supplies for making gelatin and tamales.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida de 36 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, ella vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, una población a orillas del mar Caribe, con su cónyuge, quien es ayudante en un bus intermunicipal,  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 13 años. Sus principales mercancías son los jeans, camisas y calzado informal, también vende electrodomésticos menores, como licuadoras ollas, hornos entre otras. Sus   clientes se encuentran en el mismo municipio de Puerto Colombia y los pagos de sus productos  los hacen en dos o en tres partidas. Con la cercanía del fin de año, se han incrementado los pedidos de sus clientes y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará ropa calzado y juguetes para que sus clientes logren felizmente celebrar las  navidades y año nuevo.
texts.en: Zoraida, 36, makes her living selling a variety of merchandise. She lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, a city on the shores of the Caribbean Sea. Zoraida lives with her spouse, who is an assistant on an intercity bus, and their three children whose ages range from 2 to 13 years old. The main things she sells are jeans, shirts and casual footwear. She also sells small home appliances, like blenders, pots, stoves and other things. Her customers are also in the city of Puerto Colombia, and they purchase products by making two or three payments. As the end of the year approaches, her clients’ requests have increased, and this is the reason she has requested her Kiva loan. This is the first financing she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase clothing, shoes and toys so that her clients will be able to happily celebrate Christmas and New Year’s.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: La señora Luz Dary a sus 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y accesorios que ella misma elabora; esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años desde su casa, aunque en ciertas ocasiones es ella quien visita a sus clientes. Actualmente la señora Luz Dary desea comprar insumos como telas, hilos y accesorios que le permitan elaborar más productos y así suplir la alta demanda de temporada de fin de año y  de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. A futuro la señora Luz Dary desea tener su propio almacén de ropa y accesorios.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Dary is 42 years old. She sells clothing and accessories that she produces herself. Luz has been in this business for more than 10 years and works from home. On certain occasions, she will visit her customers.

Sra. Luz Dary wants to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, and accessories so that she can produce more products and meet the high demand during the year-end season. This will help to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. In the future, Sra. Luz Dary wants to have her own clothing and accessories store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Cristo Salva 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
YoL. is the coordinator of the Cristo Salva Groups 6 & 7. Her family is made up of two children and her long-term partner. Her children are attending school, which has been her most difficult challenge because they are Haitian and they didn't know how to speak Spanish very well. She wants to have her house and a stable business, to save and live a tranquil and safe life.

YoL. is very excited to receive her second loan through Esperanza International. She took her first loan around 7 months ago and she is very grateful for the opportunity her neighbors gave her by inviting her to join the group. Receiving these loans has made possible the investment to her small business. 

YoL. produces candy with traditional preparations. She makes candies from peanuts, coconut and milk. She sells them door-to-door by walking in the streets. She will invest by purchasing milk, sugar, coconut, peanuts, cinnamon, etc.

YoL. dreams of having a beautiful house and a successful business. This group is composed of 10 Haitian immigrants located in the city of La Romana, where tourists and sugarcane are the biggest industries. They all live in a rural area called Batey, surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, coconut, peanuts, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Johanna Juana

texts.es:
Johana de 33 años, comenzó ayudar a su madre a vender cosméticos, hasta que pudo independizarse y vende cosméticos por cuenta propia.

Trabaja todos los días y cuando llega una revista ofrece sus productos a amigos y familiares. Su única dificultad es la delincuencia ya que recorre algunos sectores para vender sus productos.

Es madre soltera y con la ayuda de Dios saca adelante a sus 4 hijos de 17, 14, 4 y 3; los hijos mayores estudian en colegios fiscales. Ella quiere un prestamo para comprar cosmeticos, perfumes etc. Su meta es poder llegar a ser directora para así poder incrementar sus ventas
texts.en:
Johana is 33 years old and began helping her mother sell cosmetics until she became independent and started selling cosmetics on her own. She works every day and offers her products through catalogs to friends and relatives. Her only difficulty is dealing with the crime that exists in some of the neighborhoods where she sells her products.

Johana is a single mother. With God’s help, she has been able to assist her four children (ages 17, 14, 4, and 3) as they move forward. The older children attend public schools. Johanna wants a loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and other products. Her goal is to become a director so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and other products.

loans.name: Amalfi

texts.es: Amalfi, de 59 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Su dedicación a la agricultura es sorprendente, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano cuida de sus cultivos de maíz, papa y alcachofa, le va muy bien en su trabajo. Sobre todo en sus cultivos de alcachofa, que son bien cotizados en el mercado, pues es uno de los alimentos que se exporta a otros países; asiendo que sus cosechas sean compradas mucho antes de ser cosechadas, eso le ayuda a tener la estabilidad económica que necesita. Además cuida de animales como ovejas y cuyes los cuales cría para luego vender a los carniceros, que la visitan su casa con frecuencia. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero para tener más terrenos agrícolas y así sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Amalfi de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias ovejas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Amalfi, 59, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children, who she cares for in her own home, located in Ataura. Her dedication to farming is surprising: very early every day, she cares for her crops of corn, potatoes and artichokes. Things are going very well for her in her work, especially with regards to her artichoke crops. Her artichokes are well sought-after in the market, since this is one of the foods that is exported to other countries. As a result, her harvests are purchased well before they are harvested which helps her have the financial stability that she needs.

Additionally, she cares for animals such as sheep and guinea pigs which she raises to sell to butchers, who visit her at her home frequently. Now she would like to raise some money to have more land for farming and, subsequently, plant more to obtain better results. She belongs to the “Hacienda” Communal Bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She appreciates the support of all of you because it makes it possible for her to continue with her work. She also promises to be punctual with her repayments, since she likes working with responsible, supportive people. When Amalfi receives the loan, she will invest the money requested in the purchase of several sheep for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.
